text: I wanted to like this place. It's Restaurant week in Vegas and I look for new places or hidden gems. What I found were streaky windows, no ambiance and no taste.  Ceasar salad was overdressed and warm. The calamari was overcooked and chewy. Steak and frites were cool not warm and just bland. The salmon was good flavor and temp but the sides a throw away. I poked fun at the dated plating style but that wasn't really bad. The chocolate soufflé was good texture but tasteless. The service asked how the entree was before either of us took a bite then only returned to clear. I debated a 3 rating but when you pay over $50 each for a dinner, I think it should be good- and this wasn't. Go follow DW to their new location at the Grammercy for flavor.

This is a new place that just opened near or home. After work one day my boyfriend and I decided to stop by for dinner on a whim. Nice ambience. A bit too quiet for my liking. Ordered the burger with upgraded duck fat garlic fries and the mussels with French fries. Food was good. Service was good. The have frog legs and escargot on the menu, If that's your thing.

Tried it today for lunch and had a wonderful meal! Shared the Thai chicken burger which was deliciously juicy with the right amount of spice. It comes with crisp matchstick fries.  Enjoyed the Cobb salad, too.  Cobb salads can get a little run of the mill, but this had the best quality ingredients all around. Nicely presented and accompanied with the perfect vinaigrette on the side. The lunch menu has the right amount of choices; they also have a great wine list.  It seems that there's a lot of care and attention in the kitchen.  Delighted to have Andre go suburban!  Look forward to trying for dinner!

Andre's Bistro has finally hit its stride.  The food has always been good - we've been three times, but the service in the past was poor.  This last visit on Friday was outstanding.  The food was delicious and our server could not have been better (thanks Nathaniel!), along with the other help.  I attribute this to the review in the LVRJ newspaper that mentioned the poor service.  What a turnaround!  

As for the food, we had lunch - French onion soup (excellent), a chicken sandwich and a burger, with, of course, duck fat fries.  The chicken sandwich was declared to be delicious and my burger was one of the best I've had.  Perfectly cooked with great condiments.  The bread and butter are both wonderful.  

Overall, we can highly recommend Andre's Bistro.

This place is phenomenal!!! We came here two nights in a row and I can't wait till I get to go back. From the impeccable service to the food... they hit the nail on the head. We had the seafood platter,escargot, frog legs, oysters, to the filet to the Andre burger and mussels, the Creme brûlée. I died a little inside with every dish that came out! Delicious food. Great ambiance. Every table sitting beside me was also having the same experience as me! You could hear everyone saying how amazing every dish was. How amazing the service was. My new favorite spot! I almost want to keep it a secret because I want to keep this amazing place as my hidden gem!

I had the calamari, the filet (grass fed), duck fat fries, and I'm about to house the chocolate soufflé.  I couldn't wait to post.  This place is around the corner from my house and I'm going to be a regular!!   Cheers to this amazing mom and pop spectacular!!
Disappointing experience. Nice location and atmosphere but food was below average and our order was incorrect not once, not twice but three times. Unfortunately, will not be returning.

Andre's Bistro & Bar is a winner!  Count me in as a regular and I have only been there once.  Everything about this restaurant is excellent, from the greeting by Patrick and John  (they are genuinely happy you are there), to the ambience, to the service, and last but not least to  the incredibly delicious and exquisitely prepared food.  We dined there last night which was the first day!  You would never have guessed that because everything was seamless.   The mood is casual with soft lighting.  You can dress up or be casual, it is comfortable either way.  Service is top notch.  Our server, Mike, really knew the menu and made outstanding wine pairings.  The evening started with perfect crunchy French bread and sweet butter.  After that, we enjoyed a Caesar salad that was the real thing...beautiful Romaine leaves, homemade croutons, and dressing with anchovies.  The next course was a stunning preparation of foie gras with thinly sliced cooked apples and a vanilla sauce, which paired beautifully with my champagne.  Our entrees were the salmon with lentils and the hangar steak with green peppercorn sauce and Duck fat fries.  Everything was flavorful and perfectly prepared.  We finished with the lemon tart, something that I have been dreaming of since the days of Andre's on 6th Street.  My dream came true...just as delicious as I remembered.   Andre's is, quite simply, Fabulous!

Andres is such an awesome addition to the Southwest. Strip quality food at about half the price and no attitude (or paying to park!!). The calamari was delicious and my salmon entree was great. Perfect choice to have an upscale experience without all the hassles of leaving my neighborhood and heading to the Blvd.

This could be my new happy place! It checks the boxes: great food, relaxed atmosphere, and I can walk to it. If you live in the Southern Terrace neighborhood, get moving to this local business!I've been there 3 times in the last 10 days. Had lunch, dinner, and brunch. All were delightful. Service has been excellent every time. Shout out to Alfredo at brunch today! Haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't delicious. Stand-out items were the steak frites (traditional bistro faire done right), the creme brûlée (the shining example of what it should be), Caesar salad (classic with the right amount of garlic and anchovy), and moules frites (perfectly prepared mussels and duck fat fries). A side note on the duck fat fries: If you're a fat phobe, you're missing out. These are French fries as god intended. A leisurely stroll to a lovely bistro with great food and great service.  Next, I'm trying happy hour!  Truly transporting.  Merci, Andre!

Not sure I could have been more underwhelmed by the experience at Andre's Bistro and Bar. The only thing positive I can say is there was a warm greeting when we walked in and our busser was attentive when it came to refilling our water. 

That being said, the overall service was bummer. Our waiter took our order, ran over to tell us that if we wanted the soufflé we had to put the order in RIGHT AWAY, and that was the last time we saw him. 

Our cheese plate came out on a fly by with no explanation of what was on it. I had to flag someone down to ask what some of the accompaniments were. Then our entrees with the same drop off. 

The ribeye I ordered looked a lot more like the "flat iron" they had on the menu and was cooked all the way through. (Ordered medium rare)... I've seen better steaks on IHOP commercials. My wife's ricotta gnocchi came out surrounded by a messy plate of inedible bitter greens and a mint "paste." 

If you're thinking "why didn't you send it back" I didn't see anyone again until our water glasses were empty and wasn't going to just sit there until someone noticed us. 

I did wind up flagging down our busser again, this time to pay, after we sat there for another 10 minutes after finishing our meal. 

Maybe it was an off night as I have heard good things about Andre's but if so, it was a James Harden level off night.

Great local spot!  Watched Monday night football here at the bar and couldn't have been happier.  The service was professional and not over the top.  The food was delicious.  I strongly recommend the Charcuterie board with the Pork and Pistachio pate.  The Confit Duck with poached Egg and Frisee was also off the charts.  They told me they are also open for brunch which is definitely going to be on my to-do list for my next visit to Vegas.

Don't waste your time. Very disappointing . We waited 40 minutes for our food- soggy risotto and gnocchi soaked in a sauce. We were first to arrive at 3pm with a reservation- after others arrived they were served before us- the waiter told us it took so long because of the risotto. The ambience and décor are really lacking in creating an enjoyable setting to dine in. I am really surprised this is Andre's because I am familiar with his reputation for quality food. I have lived in Las Vegas for 40 years -I know his background. I find it hard to believe this venue will survive with so many choices here. An all around bad experience. I strongly advise to skip this place. 
By the way, I picked up an order of lettuce wraps at pei wei on my way home- they are delicious.

We went to the restaurant for Restaurant Week.   We were the first customers seated for lunch at 11:30 am.  It took us until 1 pm for dessert to be served, 2 courses eaten.  This had nothing to do with us.  I understand when a kitchen can be unorganized and run behind.  We ordered the Souffle for dessert when our order as taken at 11:40, at 1pm they said that the souffle would take 15 minutes to make and successfully talked us out of the $12 dessert.  We ordered something that we could take with us since we had spent so much time in the restaurant.  We ordered off the menu, an $8 piece of cake each, and they charged us for it because it was not on the Restaurant Week menu (that they had the inability to produce within a 95 minute timeline)  They gave us 20% off, but the dessert was added at $16 and the discount was $11.20)  The food was good, but servicewise I will not go back.

Solid 4.5 since 5 is reserved for above and beyond...

Pros:

- Lobster was delic.!  Peeps burgers and steak dishes were killed.

- Great portion for the price and good selection for lunch!

- Customer Service...as a team, they worked great together.  They even offer 10% discount on the next lunch visit with a receipt.

Cons:

- Customer Service...mixed up included green salad vs fries, but was quickly addressed and the fries was included at no charge.  Missed my lemons with my water and a bit slow on others refills.  They're new, just need more time to floss out the minor kinks.

- Fries was kind of salty...maybe it was just me having a low sodium preference.

- We were placed in the back of the restaurant when there was only two other parties there.  No biggie...just odd, but it worked out cause we were kind of laughing too much.

Stars:

- Luis G. provided great service!

Thank you Yelp for helping us find Andre's- there is no smoking which is a huge plus! Good was excellent- beet salad and Cobb salad (large servings) were delicious. I added salmon to the beet salad and it was delicious! Creme brûlée was smooth as silk! We sat at the bar and Tim was so Knowledgeable- ask him anything about menu!! He also makes a great cocktail!! We will be back this week for sure!
Love Andre's plus I live near by, I miss the MC location as I work at Aria. Alize is also so good!

Dropped in due to the good reviews.  I liked it.  Low key, friendly, neighborhood place.  Nothing fancy, just a cool place to drop by with friends and family. 

It's a Bistro, so the portions are smaller, and you order a la carte.

I had the fillet and then added a green peppercorn sauce.  I also had the green beans with almonds.  I thought the green beans were better than the fillet.  The fillet was small - 6 oz, but I didn't really want any more than that.  I had it medium rare, but I would have preferred a little more sear on the outside.  It had a piece of gristle, or silver skin running through, but it was still good.

I also had the Caesar salad, which over dressed, but the flavor was good.

So why the 4 stars?  The service was really good, and the vibe was friendly.  If I lived in the area I would go there all the time.  Andre's has a good bar set up, so dropping in and sitting at the bar would be an option.

The beer selection is not very big, but well thought out.

I'm not sure I would make the trip from the strip (which I did), but like I said, if I lived in the area, I would be there all the time.
Food was to die for along with the impeccable hospitality.  Hats off!

Andre's is great!
I've eaten here 3 times and have not been disappointed. 
Laurie and Nathaniel have been our servers, Kenny our food runner/busser/caffeine dealer. 

Notable items that have been tried by my group or myself: 
Scottish Salmon
Andre's burger (add fried egg and bacon, life's short)
Roasted beet salad
Duck a l'orange

The drinks are great too! (Sidecar, French Seventy-Five, Violet Beauregard, all good) 

Seriously, exceptional service, delicious food, and an ambiance where you can dress a little nicer or come after work and feel okay! Just go, you'll love it!!

Great place, great food, great service.  Went for brunch.  I had classic eggs benedict, very good.  Just needed more ham.  Had the appetizer, maple glazed bacon.  Amazing.  Husband had steak and eggs, eggs were really good, but steak was really thin and kind of rubbery.  Just not very good quality.  But, that really was the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

Nick gave us great service, very knowledgeable and friendly. The soufflé wa fabulous. The lamb burger and Andre's burger were so, so good.  Happy hour has a great menu and wine list. Overall a wonderful find for us!!

The food is extraordinary. But, is it worth the 'bad' service to receive it? No. This is a prime example of the designer-chef no longer involved. ( Have tried twice, my cousin once, and a coworker - we all had the same complaint: lack of service ).

My son and I had an awesome experience from the time we walked in until the time we left. The decor is beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. We started with calamari and charcuterie board for appetizers. I had the spinach and  sun dried tomato gnocchi my son the roasted chicken breast. Both dishes quite delicious! We shared the Apple tart tartin for dessert. The homemade Ice cream with caramel sauce was a nice treat to end our modern french extravaganza. We will definitely be back!

Dined a few times. I do like that fact that it is never very busy. Classic French dishes. Overall good food, just not over the top with flavor. Lamb shank is definitely my favorite, very tender and flavorful. Great local place to go for drinks.

2 things.. the food was amazing and the service and staff were not. It was really stuffy and unappreciated. However, the lamb burger and the lobster roll = WOW! Probably won't be returning for this wannabe 5 star restaurant.

The food here is to be expected.  PHENOMENAL!!!   Service was spot on perfect.  Will be back for sure.  Very refreshing to get a local restaurant that competes with the quality of strip casinos.  And at a fraction of the price.  Well done!!
World famous chef. Nice bistro in the southwest part of town. Outstanding food and staff.

Dined here on a Tuesday night and the front dining room area was filled, but not packed.  That's a good sign, especially on a Tuesday for a suburbia eatery.  We sat in a corner spot that faced a faux brick wall.  The seating was comfortable, but I wasn't thrilled with the corner ambiance.  It had no windows, so I felt a little claustrophobic.  As for the food and service, everything was delicious.  I had the Mixed Green Salad and a 6oz. Filet.  Both were prepared perfectly!  The steak was cooked medium, like I asked.  This seems to be a difficult task for a lot of restaurants, but Andre's Bistro delivered a meal exactly as I wanted.  This spot will be my new neighborhood go to gem!

Actually, 5 stars for service and 4.5 for food.  Our server was excellent.  He was super friendly and perfectly professional without being stuffy.  It's a hard balance to pull off but he was perfect.  We had the lobster roll, it's got crab meat mixed in but still excellent, served on a perfectly buttered and toasted brioche spilt top bun; lamb burger, very Greek and authentic flavors; banana foster pancakes, they adjusted for our son and subbed in maple syrup, excellent with a sour dough tang; duck fat garlic fries, crispy outside, tender inside and finished them all.  Chocolate soufflé was amazing and perfectly sized.  It was on the smaller side but perfectly intense and chocolatey.  The French onion soup was a fail.  It was way too vinegary.  Very strange for them to overdo the vinegar but I'll chalk it up to a fluke.  We'll be back for another fabulous meal soon.

Looking for a place with bottomless mimosas for a Sunday girls day brunch that's opened passed 2pm (and they are open for brunch on Saturdays & Sundays from 10:00am to 3:30pm)... AND THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT! The venue was cute, the service was attentive, the food was flavorful and we definitely got our day fade in with their bottomless mimosas! *hiccup*

They offer bottomless "all-you-can-drink" brunch with:
- 25$ MIMOSAS
- 22$ ROSE
- 20$ HOMEMADE PUNCH

In terms of eats, my eye went straight for: 
- LOBSTER ROLL ($18.00): Maine lobster, fine herbs on a buttery toasted bread roll. Comes with your choice of duck fat fries or a green salad. (I went with the salad, but ended up ordering a side of the fries when I sampled my friends -- which was $8, ouch!)
- CHICKEN & WAFFLES ($16.00): Buttermilk fried chicken, corn bread waffles with a side of country gravy. 

Would we come back? Definitely! :)

PRO TIP: They also have a happy hour menu from 3:30-5:30!
A classic in the making! Absolutely wonderful! Was lucky enough the sample a little bit of everything on the menu and it was very impressive. Great service and hospitality.

It seems that amazing Las Vegas has more talented chefs per capita than any other destination in the world. And the talent isn't confined to the Strip or even to the city itself. I've found outstanding dining  in every suburban nook and cranny and the prime example of this is Andre's Bistro in Spring Valley. 

Andre's is in a non-descript shopping center on the edge of Spring Valley, near the Wet and Wild water park, and is a bit of a car drive for many people living in the Vegas valley as well as for travelers staying in Strip-accessible lodgings. It's unpretentiously chic, with the ambience of a classic French bistro but, in keeping with the bistro tradition, the food is the true shining star of Andre's. 

Andre Rochat is a bit of a Vegas culinary icon. He ran Andre's, his Michelin star namesake restaurant at the Monte Carlo, until it closed in 2016. Andre's Bistro, run by Rochat's former employees in partnership with him, is the incarnation of Andre's in name and spirit. It's not as fancy or as expensive as the Andre's at Monte Carlo was - I think of it as the acoustic version - all of the quality stripped down to the essential of providing great food.

I started the night with an OG Mai Tai, prepared the way I like it; tart, not too sweet, and as smooth as liquid silk. I loved the maraschino cherry garnish, they use the real kind, not the radioactive fluorescent ones. It was the best mai tai I've ever had, the night was off to a good start. 

The menu is classic French, not Cal-French, so they don't do anything odd or extravagant here. I was pleased to see Dover Sole on the menu ($55, that's a rare find). I started with the Spring Risotto ($22, $15 for happy hour) made with ramps,  brussel sprouts, and goat cheese. It's served al dente (as stated on the menu) and, while I wasn't used to the crunch in the rice, it wasn't unpleasant. The risotto itself was hearty and vibrant, imbued with the earthiness of the ramps and brussel sprouts. I loved the burst of sweetness the tomatoes provided. Overall, it was a well-rounded dish, surprisingly, crunchy rice and all.
 
Next I moved on to the Moules Frites ($15 for happy hour), made with PEI mussels, garlic, parsley, saffron, and cream. It is served with a side of duck fat fries that were perfectly flavorful and crisp. The mussels theselves were fresh and clean tasting and greatly enhanced by a delicious broth that I couldn't stop sopping up with my bread. My dining companion got the Potato Gnochhi and it was the lightest, fluffiest gnocchi I've ever had. All the dishes were delicious, but I'd say the gnocchi was the big winner of the night. 

Andre's also has a full stocked bar and a decent wine list with French labels at reasonable prices. In summary, the restaurant is a local gem. The values during happy hour are insane and include Saturdays from 3pm - 6pm. It's destination dining for both visitors and locals looking for high-end,  Strip quality food in a comfortably non-bougey setting. Andre's Bistro has happily earned a place in my regular rotation, especially during happy hours.
I've been here a few times and I'm always happy! The Coq au vin (fall off the bone, melt in your mouth) and lamb are delicious! Nice smaller restaurant with good atmosphere and not too noisy.

A friend recommended and brought me to this place, even tho I'm not typically a fan of French food. 

Restaurant js a good size in a strip mall. We went about 6:30 on Saturday night and it was not very busy but not slow either. We were seated immediately. Service was fast waiter came right over to take drink orders and bring bread. Bread was very good. 
 The menu has a good variety of options of French food as well as some salads and "American" sides/ appetizers. Prices were ok a little on the high side but the restaurant looked to be presentable.

I had the Cobb salad and a side of sweet potato fries. Definitely get a large on the salads as the small is in a pretty small extremely shallow bowl and you don't get much salad (despite asking the waiter what the size of the salad was). Other than that salad looked and tasted fresh. 
 Fries were pretty soggy and portion was pretty small for $6. 

The reason for this place getting 2 stars is, before I left I used the bathroom and it was DISGUSTING. Paper on the ground, garbage overflowing, feces in the toilet bowl stuck to the side, some brown contents all over the sink (see pictures) ... this tells me that If a restaurant can't keep a clean  public space such as a bathroom you never know what there kitchen looks like where the public doesn't see. It really turned me off and made me leave in disgust.

Won't be back.

This place was just as awesome as DW Bistro, which used to be at that location. The bottomless house punch was very good and strong! The chicken and waffles was quality, especially the perfectly fried chicken! I love the chill atmosphere her too! Definitely worth checking out!

Andre's has recently become my family's favorite neighborhood spot. It seems like we have brunch there at least twice a month. The food is always tasty and service on point. I took my mom their while she was visiting and she fell in love to. It was the only place she wanted to eat at while in town!
Words cannot describe our dinner tonight. All I can say is that they will do well.  Excellent food and service.  I will post lots of pics for you to enjoy.

One of the worst brunch spots ive been too in Vegas. I dont even know where to start: the drink service was quick but pricey, the food service was slow and the food wasn't all that great when it did arrive. It's breakfast for goodness sake!!!! I honestly felt cheated for my time and money. I'll stick to Paris Baguette Cafe or DW Bistro which are both about 5 minutes east of here. 

Our party of 14 were sectioned off so we couldn't gauge how busy the other side was, but it took over an hour for the food to come out and when it did it came out it came in spurts. A few people got their food and by the time they finished the other people got theres. It was a disjointed mess. At some points people from the party had to find the server and ask what was going on. She kept saying the same thing -"its coming out". We werent in a rush but at a certain point theres only so much you can drink and you start to notice how long youve been waiting. I thought about cancelling my order and cutting my losses. 


The food arrived ONE HOUR and 15 MINUTES after ordering. During this wait no apologies, no visit from the manager, no comp pastry baskets. Nothing.  Just wait, wait and wait so more, pay and leave. No hospitality. No one even ordered a well done steak. Just eggs, a burger and a few salads. I was so disappointed when my food arrived. For one, I told the server specifically how I wanted the fried egg cooked and it came out over easy! I told her to cook it hard. The food came back made correctly in under 5 minutes. I was surprised because the entire order took over an hour! The Croque Madame was a sad dish to have waited over an hour for. I've had better at walk up cafes made in 10 minutes. This one was just a burnt piece of toast topped with a thin slice of ham, swiss cheese and bechamel sauce and a egg on top. Its typically a sandwhich with two pieces of bread and stuffed with ham and cascading with bechamel sauce, but these guys are apparently cutting costs. The top looked burnt, dried out and as if it's been sitting in the expo window for the better part of 30 minutes. The duck fat fries are NOTHING to write home about. Ive had better fries at McD's. 

Also the bottomless mimosas are more than most entrees on the menu at a staggering $24.99. I'm not sure when the trend started to charge locals so much for cheap champagne bought at whole sale prices mixed with ready made orange juice. Not even fresh squeezed or even with a garnish on the glass. 

While the server was nice i don't think she cared because she was getting an automatic gratuity. We all finished in 30 minutes and there we started the wait again as she scrambled to organize the checks. She had over an hour to get those ready.  Thankfully, i paid cash. Like I said I won't be back and I won't be sending any of my friends there or my guests.
I haven't found very many places in Las Vegas with great French food--but this place is superb. It's a trendy / classy atmosphere and would definitely recommend as worth a try.

Excellent restaurant off the strip. Its nice to have a higher quality local restaurant and not have to schlep out to the strip just for dinner. The new location is in a plain strip mall, but the restaurant itself has great curb appeal. It has the same layout of the former DW Bistro, but it has a French farm-to-table feel once you walk inside.

The blonde waitress we had (apologize that the name escapes me if she is reading this) was excellent and has been with Andre for a number of years. Always a good sign when the staff is loyal to the brand! We all ordered French onion soup and I had the mussels and frites. French Onion Soup was a tad underwhelming considering that we were at a French restaurant but the mussels and frites were divine. Mussels is my go-to order whenever I see it on a menu, and Andres' mussels reminded me of the time I lived in France- so good!

Of course we had to try the grand mariner soufflé which was the best thing I had all night. Make sure you place your order with your food! It was heaven.

I checked out their brunch menu while I was there, looks excellent and can't wait to go back!

Would like to give it a better review but chef 34 dollars for 1/4 of a roast duck l'orange however delicious it was does not make a meal. So the duck fat French fries were OK had better .
Lamb shank delicious and at least it comes with orzo . All told will not go back to expensive for what I got.

Did it through delivery so the quality I'm sure is better in the restaurant but still it was very good. The French onion soup was slightly bland but at the bottom you notice the bigger herbs and the taste comes out wonderfully. The risotto was great with so much mushrooms and you can tell it's made fresh. The price point is slightly high for the amount but I would still return. If they lowered the prices a few dollars I could see myself adding this to our normal rotation of restaurants
Seriously divine food!!! Got the mussels and OMG, probably the best meal I've had in a while!!!! Freshly squeezed juices and great service!!!

Being a regular at Alize (which has sadly closed) I was looking forward to trying out André Rochat's new neighborhood French Bistro. Lovely intimate setting, pleasant ambiance.

Went with my girlfriends around 4 pm and found out they have happy hour from 3-6 pm everyday! You heard me right, everyday and in the entire restaurant, not just bar area.

Beautiful wine selection, by the glass is $2 off for happy hour. I ordered a sparkling rose which was light and crisp. 

Our server was very friendly and suggested some good vegetarian and Vegan options. I love gnocchi so decided to try that. It was delicious, served in a light creamy butter sauce, tender melt in your mouth gnocchi topped with crispy thin onions. My friends tried mushroom risotto which was fantastic.

If you love soufflé, their Grand mariner and chocolate soufflé is an absolute must! I tried cream brûlée which was excellent, the crust on top was perfect. 

I can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu :)

Came here on a date. Was super excited because I loved the original one Downtown.  While the vibe is different and the menu slightly 'less complicated', I loved it! Was happy to see they kept the street sign.  I had the calamari and beet salad. The calamari had an amazing sauce.  Then the flat iron steak with bordelaise sauce was absolutely delicious.  As we're the mussels.  I plan to come often.
Very nice. Food is great and service on point. I wish the price-point was more adapted to the local market. Too close to Strip pricing.
Quality French Food!  If you like chicken, the coq au vin is very tasty and I would highly recommend it. This spot has great service, and a nice little bar area inside.

Andre's is a welcome addition to the Vegas dining scene! The food quality coupled with reasonable prices prove that "you don't need a silver fork to eat good food," - a quote  by Paul Prudhomme featured on their exterior that encapsulates what Andre's has to offer. 

HAPPY HOUR: My first visit for HH was stellar. Bar seating, TV tuned to a Spurs game, attentive but unobtrusive service, and incredible food. The frog legs ($8) were a pleasant start to the meal but Andre's burger (a $7 steal!) stole the show, with gooey gruyere, red onion marmalade, and truffle mayo coming together to combine the flavors of a burger with French onion soup. The sturdy pretzel roll held up well, too.  It was marvelous and that burger was on my mind for days. Days! 

BRUNCH: Came with a group and tried several dishes but was less impressed. Standouts were the escargots (so garlicky, request extra bread!), Artisanal Sausage Platter (loved the lamb!), the crispy Liege-style Belgian waffles, classic French Onion soup, duck fat fries, and the desserts (order the souffle ahead of time). Unfortunately, several dishes were marred by cooking errors. The Chicken and Waffles featured a great gravy but limp waffles and soggy chicken, while Andre's Classic Benedict was skimpy on the ham and unremarkable other than the side of crispy potatoes. Most of the items on a friend's charcuterie board went unfinished while a burger was received at the wrong temperature. Our server wasn't around much and refills had to be requested but he was pleasant enough. Perhaps they were understaffed. 

"First we eat, then we do everything else," (MFK Fisher)- The dishes I liked I really liked and would return for, while I remain hopeful that a future dinner visit will fare better than brunch in terms of execution and satisfaction. 

TIP: Happy Hour is 3:30-5:30, daily. It's the only time the Bistro Hot Dog is available; it's made in-house and regularly sells out. I've yet to have it but hear it's worth the wait.

Andre's is being talked about in local publications as well as it should. At its price point its pound for pound in the top 10 restaurants in Las Vegas. 

My meal started with a cheese plate and seared foie gras. This foie gras was easily the best I've had in my life. It lit up my mouth in places I didn't know I had. We had a beet and caesar salad respectively, the beets at this place are amazing, I don't normally like beets but they're amazing here. 

Finally the entree, I had the golden trout and my partner the filet mignon. Everything was sincerely perfect and the waiting staff was on point. Exactly the right amount of service without being patronizing. 

The desert was out of this world, the pastry chef is up to any bistro in France's standard. I'd come here again. Everyday if I could. 

10/10, thank you Andre's!

So excited to have Andre's on the west side of town!   The food was excellent had the Fois Gras, Wild Mushroom Risotto and the Chocolate Soufflé.  All we amazing, can't wait to go back this weekend for brunch !

Being a local of this area for many years and frequently dining at the last restaurant here, when Andre's popped up I was interested in checking it out. 

My first time here was for happy hour-

Cheese Board-the jam served with it was not great and they did have pickles and mustard but I think it just needed more variety with it-maybe more jams or nuts. The cheese was just ok. 

Frog Legs-my husband said he was not a fan

Andre's Burger-I really enjoyed this. I loved the fries too. When I asked for medium, they actually gave me medium. First time that has happened in forever. 

Lyonnaise Salad-way too vinegary. I am not a fan of all frisee salad I have found out. It is too boring for me. The lardons were huge which some would appreciate but I felt it overwhelmed the light frisee. 

Service was great. My first time here would not exactly bring me back, but I am curious about their main dishes.

Really wanted to like the food, but was disappointed. Got the foie gras and lamb shank. The piece of foie gras itself was really small like the size of my palm. It was seared, but tasted burnt and part of the fat of a steak with a liver aftertaste. The combo was weird also, it came with a sweet berry cream-like sauce and almond crumble. If they hadnt given me bread I probably wouldnt have finished it. 

The lamb shank was better. Very large portion. I don't think they should serve it with orzo pasta, the sauce had an overpowering tomato taste. Mashed potatoes, veggies, or even couscous would be better. I hope to come here again and try their HH or something different and hopefully better.

1/2 Ambiance - The lighting needs a little improvement
 Service - Hostess (Ally) , Food Server (Thomas) , Buspersons 
1/2 Food - Fois Gras was tasty, Wife had the Trout and was delicious with a healthy serving, I had the 10oz NY Strip (I asked for Medium Rare, but was closer to Medium), duck fat fries was tasty, and the chocolate soufflé was awesome.
 Good luck and congrats John and Chef Marty!

Honestly, we had a terrible time at Andre's on Saturday night. It was packed, which is completely expected for a Saturday night, but the restaurant was totally understaffed. It was 20-30 minutes between each contact with our server. We were at our table for 30+ minutes before actually ordering our food and an hour before we got our appetizers.

We ordered the foie gras app and the meat was burnt to a crisp, completely inedible, and couldn't even be cut. The french onion soup was basically salty water. Our entrees were only a little better, definitely needing salt, but it took so long for the server to come over to us that we ended up asking the table next to us to borrow theirs. When we would ask a busser or food runner for something (salt, lemon, more water) they would leave and never come back. Our server was really nice and we actually felt bad for her. It was only her second weekend there and she was totally overwhelmed. 

We finished eating and sat there for another 30 minutes, trying to flag SOMEONE down to bring us our check. The server brought the bill and we gave her our card, only to have her come back 10 minutes later to say that the register was having some sort of issue and our card couldn't be ran. She disappeared again before we could get a proper explanation...we didn't bring enough cash, soooo what would they like us to do? Again, we sat for minutes wondering what was going on. We finally flagged down the manager (who never showed up when we originally asked for her) and asked her what the deal was? We had $50 in cash and the bill was $59...could we use our card to pay or not? She didn't apologize, but told us "...to just go." 

I guess we got a few dollars off our bill, but what kind of manager responds like that?! I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone and we will never go back. We couldn't decide which was worse, the service or the food. When all was said and done, we were there for two and a half hours and only spent about 30 minutes of that actually eating!! The rest of the time was spent praying for someone to come to our table. The worst!

This is exactly what the local restaurant community needed! This place has a beautiful and up beat atmosphere! The menu can please anyone. The daily cheese selections an appetizer was the best first choice to go along with a nice glass of wine. Great wine selection too! I would highly recommend the trout, absolutely delicious! And you definitely cannot leave with having the Soufflé for dessert! Everyone in our party enjoy there dinners! We will all be back! And most importantly we loved our waiter Mike!

Love so many things about this place. So so happy that Andre decided to open a Bistro in the neighborhood! Love the quotes on the windows, interior is warm and comfortable. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Now... onto the food... the punch is so so good! Steak frites, the muscles!!!! Everything is amazing! The lemon tart is my favorite...
Staff and Food / Cocktails were outstanding. really enjoyed fathers day brunch !   Andre's has always been awesome !!! Highly Recommend !

I'm really loving this place! Our waiter Michael was amazing and informative and very nice! I ordered the roasted chicken and it was absolutely delicious! It was very moist and flavorful. Our table also ordered the oysters and they were so fresh and delicious! Everything we ordered was awesome! This will b our new favorite spot! Highly recommend.. go!!

Im not one to give negative feedback but this was a bit disturbing. First off, i walked in and stood there for a couple minutes and not one person approached me, welcomed me, acknowledged that i was there, nor asked if I have been helped. So i was just standing there staring at the menus, and mind you i work at the hospital as a nurse so i came in and expect to get right out for a quick lunch break, but still nothing, and it wasnt at all busy.
So i approached the bar and finally made eye-contact with the bartender and said i was there for pick up. 
I received the bill $17 something. i paid with $20 and said just to keep the change. All she said was "do you atleast want the receipt?" No thank you or nothing.
Im driving and actually took a look at the bill and this is what really burst my bubble. They charged 18% gratuity ! ... for a Chicken Sandwhich! For a bill of ONE PERSON! FOR AN ORDER FOR PICK UP! Blew my mind, i have never seen any establishment charge gratuity for a one person one sandwhich take out bill. so basically i paid for TWO TIPS, in which they were actually undeserving of it given the lack of hospitality and unfriendly bartending service (blonde hair, no smile whatsoever). Im more so obligated to give 1 star on here but if it was up to me no star. Unbelievable.

I just want to say, I'm very disappointed.....in myself that I did not come here sooner. I cannot count how many times I've passed by this restaurant and told myself "I need to try this place." After seeing that they were participating in Restaurant Week, I finally made the effort to go! 

Andre's is located in the old DW Bistro. It's a great neighborhood restaurant and honestly, for those living in the southwest, we are lucky! It was a busy night when we went (Thursday night) so I would recommend making reservations. We got seated right away which was nice. Service was great from beginning to end. I should've gotten the name of our server! I had asked him some questions regarding the menu and he was able to answer them without any hesitation, so props to him. 

Onto the food! 

- Wagyu beef carpaccio: loved this! It has a nice contrast with the smoked sea salt and capers. 

- Seared foie gras: this was definitely melt-in-your-mouth type tx. It comes with figs (?) and basalmic reduction along with shaved parmesan. 

- duck a l'orange: it was cooked perfectly. I was expecting more of a orange taste to it (bc name of entree) but the sauce that came with it is lightly seasoned with the orange taste. 

- lobster thermidor: omg this was phenomenal! It came in a bowl. The bottom of it consisted of mashed potatoes, and there were asparagus and mushrooms. Big chunks of lobster too. 

- creme brûlée: you can tell it's made with real vanilla beans bc there's black specks in the custard. I really liked this dessert. There was a nice crunch from the sugar coating and the custard itself wasn't super sweet. 

- chocolate walnut gateau: This was meh for me. But honestly it's bc I'm not a huge fan of walnuts. The dark chocolate layer on top was good though.

I will definitely be back! I really liked everything that was served.
Great food and service at Andre's Bistro & Bar! They offer a vegan risotto that is delish that I paired with salmon- yummy! They offer many delicious desserts too.

Without doubt...the best local secret! Quality of service, food and most importantly, fresh produce makes this our go to place.

Brunch, lunch, glass of wine and appetizers, happy hour and dinner.

Andre treats his staff like family and it shows!

100% recommend 

Well done Andres Family/staff  We love you!

Glad to have another go to place to eat.  Food is refreshing.  Thai burger was juicy.  Escargot was spot on- sauce was great to dipped the bread in.  Salads are fresh and tasty.  Our sever is very attentive.  Gave an option of salad versus fries.  Would definitely come back.

Omg! Take me to Paris! Food was delicious,  we had the Benedict, chicken and waffles, shuffle and some beignets to go. All were amazing! No complaints, it was our 1st time here and will be back for dinner soon!

If I could give this place a minus star, I would. You should be ashamed of yourself by calling this place, a French restaurant. I have been to Paris, France and  let me tell you, the French
food there is excellent as well as the service. I ordered the Golden Trout Amandine, and it looks
really yucky to look at. I took a bite of the trout and it tasted like salmon. I sent the food back, it was so horrible. There for dinner all I had to eat was bread and butter, because I ordered the steak, and I had to send that back too. Such horrible food. At a least a free dessert would have been nice to rectify the situation, and to warrant a second chance to try this restaurant again.
I paid $12 for the tiny Andre's Classic Souffle, it was good but not worth the price. I hope this restaurant closes soon. Chef Andre you created an epic failure.You failed to convince me to return to your restaurant, and a simple I'm sorry from the waitress does not do anything to rectify my anger and disappointment.

I love French restaurants and French food. Well, OK, I'm French, maybe that's why.
So of course I was very excited when I heard Andre's would reopen off the Strip, and wanted to try it.
The place is nice and cosy, with kind of a Parisian design and atmosphere. 
Food was OK, in a reasonable price range. The snails (yes, I eat snails and I loooove it!) were pretty tasteful, unlike some other places in town.
On the other hand, I would strongly suggest they improve their service and staff. This was really disappointing. It took forever to get someone willing to take my order. Then they weren't aware of the prices for the specials of the day. Food took like 30 minutes to come out of the kitchen... Major progress to be done on this.
Very nice restaurant! We took our food to go but if we had the time I would have loved to dine in.  Everything tastes really fresh and full of flavor.

I was highly impressed with this establishment!

For those of you who frequent this area of Las Vegas, this building used to be DW Bistro. Good news is that DW Bistro moved down the street and even better news is this awesome restaurant is now in business.

First off, customer service was amazing. From the host to the server to our busser -- everyone was exceptionally kind and came around often to ask us how we were doing.

I ordered the lobster roll and HOLY MOLY, it was love at first bite. The lobster was seasoned just right and the roll was the right amount of buttery. And the fries that came along with the lobster roll were on point also. 

Will definitely be back to try more items on the menu. Spoiler alert: this place is a tad bit on the pricier side, but it's totally worth it.
Great place with awesome service. I had salmon benedict which had perfect texture and was delicious. I highly recommend their white sangria !
Yum! Great food and cute and cozy ambiance! I had the salmon burger which was delish, and my dad had the gnocchi which was super rich and yummy.
Excellent food, friendly staff. Location might be better, but the place is friendly, and the food is great. Best kept secret and a great eating place in SW Vegas.

i found out that andre's was opening in the southwest from a bartender at the rum runner on desert inn.  i was addicted to the food there because scott sampson was the awesome chef behind all of the amazing dishes coming out from a little window in that smoky bar.  we were informed that he had left rum runner to rejoin chef andre at his new venture.  needless to say, i was eagerly awaiting the opening and i couldn't wait to sink my teeth into those duck fat fries again.

so a bunch of us went right after andre's opened.  we took advantage of the happy hour menu and we were beyond satisfied.  scott sampson has done it again and i am so glad i can just go to a restaurant and eat his food whenever i want again.  he's one of those chefs that doesn't get nearly enough credit for his talent.  his food is remarkable.

the happy hour is reasonably priced and portions are generous.  my favorite thing has to be the burger and duck fat fries.  the escargot was quite delicious too.  i can't wait to go back for more!

This is in the old DW Bistro spot. I like the vibe when you first walk In. Our server was very attentive he was great. We ordered the following

ricotta gnocchi- we thought it was going to be in a red sauce but surprisingly it was gnocchi with lots of veggies much lighter than what you would expect. And we couldn't taste the ricotta. 

Chicken sandwich- my husband said was weak, tasteless.  We asked for a side of truffle Mayo, there is something up with the truffle here I'm guessing the chef uses truffle salt?! It was salty!!!! 

Pea Barley soup with truffle- the truffle smelled great but it was SOOOOO SALTY ! We sent it back.

French onion soup - that was yummy

Grand Marnier Creme Brûlée- this was the BEST Part of the meal.

I may come back and try the weekend brunch but lunch was not what I expected. The menu items sounded better than they tasted

I have been a fan of Andre Rochet since I moved to Las Vegas in 1991. My wife Sandy and I have frequented Andre's Bistro and Bar four times since their opening week and have found the food to be consistently wonderful and the service to be expert and cordial. We will return again and again as it is a bargain to boot.

When your biggest issue is lighting for your food pictures, you know you have found a good spot. 

Met my ladies for our semi-monthly lunch date. On first impression, I liked the aesthetic changes they made as this space was formerly DW Bistro. (Not that DW wasn't also adorable.) Glasses of sparkling rosé were clinked, and we took on the world from our table in the cozy back corner of the main dining room. 

My friends both enjoyed lobster rolls (they looked good but a bit overdressed for my taste.) I ordered the Thai chicken burger - and folks - it was so clucking good!!

The ground chicken was delightfully seasoned and served on a PRETZEL BUN (Yass!!) with a delicious aioli and sautéed peppers. Duck fat fries were an option but I went with their lightly dressed mixed greens instead. It's been 24 hours and I'm still thinking about this burger, it's that good. 

When it was time to order dessert, one of my friends placed her order for the lemon tart, and our charming waiter asked if we would all be sharing it--and we laughed and laughed. Two lemon tarts and a chocolate walnut gateau later and we were 3 very happy ladies. 

The lightly brûléed lemon wedge was a citrusy flavor explosion, and the tart itself was to die for. I tasted the gateau and it was also heaven on a plate.

We might not have been able to solve all of society's problems during this lunch date, but I'm sure we will give it a go again in the future, and I'm already planning a trip back with my husband for dinner. Whoever said money can't buy happiness has clearly never eaten here.

Let me start by saying I do like Andres and will be back for dinner.
Sharrie had the Madame and it was quite tasty. She asked for the yoke to be hard and even sending it back never happened. The potatoes were greasy and under seasoned. 
I had the Andre burger with an egg on it. Again                           it was under seasoned but quite tasty.
Service seemed confused and not the most personable. Lots of personnel but no one asked if we been there before or offer any interaction except for the basic service.
With all that said I still want to try dinner there, in hopes that is where they excel.

Went in for brunch on a Saturday afternoon after hearing great things about this place and was left very disappointed. The food was decent but service was horrible. 

We were a group of five and wanted to start with some beignets which we ordered the same time as our oysters, sad to say that the beignets never came. The French Onion Soup was nice and flavorful unlike most of the rest of our meal. The lobster roll was bland and nothing on it popped or stood out as far as flavors. The quiche Loraine was cold, soggy and mucus like. I also ordered a side of the potato salad which when I asked the waiter was explained as a potato dish with eggs mixed with mayonnaise and mustard. When it actually came out it was the same as the breakfast potato dish that someone from our table received, sautéed finger potatoes with onions. I pointed out to the busser and waiter that this was not what I ordered and they then continued to convince me that what I got was actually their potato salad. I didn't want to send the food back or argue with them so I decided to give it a try and was unpleased with how much they lacked salt, but had an overpowering taste of black pepper. When we asked to get some of the food to go one of the ladies that worked there gave us attitude since we had to ask her to wrap it up again after she had left the dish on the table for 20 min after cleaning the table off before the desserts arrived. The desserts on the other hand were amazing. As a group we ordered the milk shake, creme brûlée, the sundae and pot de creme. Mmmmm.... all of them were beautifully executed. I probably enjoyed the pudding dish the most. It was like a chocolate truffle pudding. I wouldn't mind giving the place another try but I hope I don't get the same staff.
Amazing food and great atmosphere. The root beer float, the mushroom risotto, and the  flat iron steak paired well

I had been here once before for brunch and had a good experience. Tonight, I showed up at 6pm with a friend and there were upwards of 15 empty tables. We were told that without a reservation, we wouldn't be able to be seated until at least 8:15. We were flat out turned away. We felt as tho this was on purpose because I was in jeans and sneakers and my friend was in sweats. On yelp they are listed as casual, and there were even young kids seated inside. I won't be going back to this restaurant sadly, their food is pretty good.

I finally got a chance to stop in! I was first enticed by the fact they served escargot. And it did not disappoint in the least! The chef sent me out an amazing creation of foie gras and duck fat and I'm pretty sure I died and went to heaven. I finished my meal off with a sundae and some port. I can't wait to try more items. Good drink menu, not overpriced. I will be back!

So I found this place on Yelp and was impressed by their Happy Hour menu, unfortunately this isn't the first place which impressed me on paper but decided to give it a shot since it's close to home.
The place had a much nicer interior than I expected. I started off with the escargots, which were out of the shell but tasty thanks to a buttery sauce. Next we each ordered the Waygu steak...now mind you, this 8oz Waygu was $18..that's right $18!! The American Waygu 8oz steak at CUT is $85 and this piece of meat was everything you dream of, perfectly charred on the outside with a melt in your mouth texture...it was amazing. I had the Peppercorn sauce while my girl had the bernaise...I recommend the peppercorn. With our steaks we had an order of Lobster Mac & Cheese, it was the perfect balance of cheese and lobster...not too much cheese to overwhelm the lobster. To end our meal I had the crème brûlée while my girl had the Chocolate Crème Pot...you honestly cannot go wrong. I cannot express how happy we are to have found this gem, we are already looking forward to our next visit and are recommending it to all our friends.....and the topper...our entire meal (no alcohol) was $70...you cannot beat this place for quality, taste and price.
Yummy yummy and very close to my house. Service was good I like the twist on the hamburgers and my wife loved her fish

This place is literally a classic French bistro. The food is rustic, things are made from scratch, the prices make sense because many of the plates and rich and succulent, like somebody's mother made me this meal. Highly recommended eating with wine. And the cocktails I've had were complex yet subtle. Definitely have one with dessert.

We were checking this place out to try something new this weekend. While I believe this place is typically better than 2 stars, I can't give it above 2. 

-My lobster roll was quite tasty, but the star of the show was the way above average roll. The lobster was well seasoned but didn't taste fresh. Part of my side salad was wilted. 

-My boyfriend got the creamsicle, and to me it was hands down the best thing on the table. 

-My water glass on the table had a lipstick stain. No one noticed. 

-The hostess literally dropped the wine list on the table... like the leaning tower of Pisa fell and crashed into the bread plate, extra flatware, and knocked the salt shaker over. And she just froze then bolted away! And we though "good evening" from her at 1 p.m. was weird. 

- The croque madame was solid, and the best food item. 

-The waiter was friendly, prompt, and on his "A" game. 

-The single espresso is one of the best I've had at a restaurant on or off the strip. 

-The ginger beer was above average.

-The bartender just stood around texting. 

-The old-fashioned was by far the worst one that I have ever had. I've had some bad ones. Some that have tasted like a bottle of bitters; others that were shaken. Dear goodness, this was an all new low. Plus, I was never asked, which bourbon or whiskey I wanted. It was like drinking Kool-aid and Maker's Mark. So sweet that I took 2 sips and got a headache. Completely undrinkable. 

I want to like this place. I used to eat at Andre's in the Monte Carlo. It was a well-deserved Michelin one star restaurant. This was like the disappointing distant relative to the original. Maybe it was because it was brunch, but I don't want to go for dinner with all of the service and cocktail issues.

"Go to the people and places that set a spark in your soul."

Andre's Bistro & Bar is the perfect neighborhood French Bistro!

The Monte Carlo lost out when they opted to move on from Andre's, but fortunately for residents on the southwest side of town, Chef Rochart and his team decided to reinvent themselves in a familiar bistro style concept the neighborhood should adore.  

Andre's Bistro & Bar doesn't bring with it all the sophistication of their former establishment, but they do bring absolutely incredible food and excellent service. The setting and ambiance are ideal for their new Summerlin hood--elevating what the former DW Bistro had to offer, while bringing along a few remnants from their previous incarnation. I really enjoyed dinning in this space. It has a warm, inviting felling, and there was a great energy throughout the restaurant the evening that we came.

The food doesn't disappoint. My love and I started with the escargot and then shared the Mushroom Risotto and the Lamb Shank, before finishing our meal off with the Grand Marnier Soufflé. We were dinning with our best friends and took the opportunity presented to try the Roasted Beet Salad as well. The menu features classic and refined French cuisine as well as a few contemporary items. The wine list nice and features some quality new world wines as well as several French wines.

Andre's Bistro & Bar is nice enough to take a date to, but it is really is an excellent choice for a double date, a small group of friends, or a business lunch.

A fantastic french restsurant,bread, escargot & amazing mussels in a saffron cream sauce.  The good was superb,  the wait staff we're so attentive.  Great wine selections, 
Deserts.  This was such amazing food experience.

I feel very fortunate to have a restaurant with food this good so close to home. The service standards and hospitality layered in on top make this a real blessing. Oysters were fresh and ice cold, escargots were piping hot any garlicky ( I suggest some fries for the extra butter ), the foie gras sear was a perfect mahogany with just the perfect balance is sweet and savory. For entrees I loved the house-made sausages or the trout amandine but the roasted chicken was also great. If you do nothing else though you have to try the walnut gateaux & apple tarte tatin.

I love this place. It's very quaint and has great food options. I enjoy their brunch menu items on the weekend and although their unlimited mimosas are a bit pricey at $25 (compared to other places) I must say they do NOT cheap out on the champagne which is just how I like it. If you are looking for great french cuisine, this is the place and you will not be disappointed.

Staff-rude. Especially hostesses Who point out your mistakes on open table when you arrive and even turn the computer around to make sure you understand your mistake. 
Appetizers-excellent. Caesar salad with real anchovies and the seafood platter but both outstanding. 
 Beverages-great. Excellent cocktails and  interesting and reasonably priced wine list. 
Entrees-disappointing. The burger and the salmon we're both a little overcooked. The muscles had sat too long under the heat lamp. The muscles were replaced but this time the sauce was like warm water. 
We did enjoy our experience here. The appetizers and cocktails made it worthwhile, I just wish the staff were a little more professional. After spending over $225 it would be nice if someone could wish you a good night when you leave!
Is there no manager on duty?

For my first meal of 2018, I came here. I didn't know anything about it other than it had frog legs on the menu, and I wanted them. It's in a good location not far from 215. I got there around 4:30PM so it wasn't too busy, yet, but happy hour is between 3-6PM. I sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and almost too accommodating, but without being pushy. This was appreciative. It almost felt like he was being a good host at his house, rather than an employee behind the bar.

Aside from the frog legs, I saw they also had escargot (which I also like) but I opted for the cheese and charcuterie board instead. The frog legs didn't take long at all. They were good but maybe just a tad bland, though that's less of the frog and more of the batter surrounding it. I would have like a little more flavor, personally. The cheese and meat board was excellent. There was a nice variety of meat, cheese, pate, fruit, and olives. On top of that, combining different things yielded so many different flavors. Highly recommended.

While it isn't necessarily close to my house, I'm definitely going to come back, especially for happy hour. Prices on most of the menu are reduced, including beer and wine.

Consistently good food and drinks.  In the summer we like the outside patio seating.  We love brunch or dinner here.  Brunch chicken and waffles yum yum, coq a van, bouillabaisse, chicken pot pie, man so many great options!   Any of the burgers we've tried are great affordable filling options as well.

One of the best lunches i have ever had..that i felt compelled to write a review here. My younger sister and I decided to stop by Andre for lunch today, even though the establishment looked rather empty..we decided to still give it a try based on the yelp reviews and i must say...i agree with every single positive review here. I ordered a thai chicken burger, and my sister opted for the steak with herb butter and duck fat fries..and everything was AMAZING! We also decided to share a soufflé, which I have decided I won't be sharing the next time..keeping one for myself! I will definitely be back here again, and again

first time to this restaurant.  went during happy hour.  many restaurants restrict happy hour to the bar only, but not them which i like.  had  escargot for 7! they were great, esp the garlic sauce which was absorbed nicely with their bread.  had discounted coq au vin which tasted great.  friend had a nice piece of salmon. he must eat gluten free and they accommodated him nicely.  they even had gluten free rolls which he said were some of the best he's ever had.  service was great.  discounts on all drinks for happy hour.  we will be back!

Service was excellent, food was so delicious! The best Duck fat fries! The mussels were so flavorful and very beautifully presented. A very relaxed feel toned down fine dining. We sat on patio and still had excellent service. The burger was delicious as well! Highly recommend there desserts as well! Saturday Sundae!!
Can't recommend. Soufflé was probably the worst I've ever had. Took two bites and done. I did enjoy the daily special of coq au vin. The other dishes in my group not so much...
The ambiance is nice and staff is great!!! Portion size super small and honestly didn't taste great.. BUT the duck fat fries were yummy!

We went to Andre's today for brunch, and were very pleased with our experience. The service was impeccable, the quality of the meal was excellent, and the price was completely reasonable. Having dined at the Monte Carlo location several times previously, I had very high expectations for this new neighborhood gem. It definitely did not disappoint. My only concern was that there were a lot of small children, and this made the overall noise level high.  Would love to return to this location for dinner, and hopefully enjoy an intimate and romantic meal. PS, the wine by the glass selection is absolutely amazing.
Lobster roll was really good. Great little french bistro, will definitely frequent this place
We had a wonderful dinner last week! The sea food is really good and the Andres burger as well the service is impeccable and the atmosphere as well! He had so much fun!

We came here for my birthday brunch while we were in Vegas. It wasn't my first choice, because my first choice wasn't taking any more reservations. Not wanting to wait an hour for brunch, I searched yelp frantically and came across this place. The reviews looked promising and our group was mainly looking forward to eating chicken & waffles (which Andre's has) so we decided to check it out. The restaurant itself is very welcoming and cute. I really loved the decor from the ceilings to the floor, it was very cute and sleek. Our service was also great the entire visit. My reason for giving them 3 stars is for the food we received. 3/4 of my group ordered chicken & waffles. Although it didn't taste bad at all, the breading was falling off of the chicken and the waffles were completely falling apart. It just didn't hold together, which made it incredibly hard to eat. My bloody mary was also just so-so, and the beignets were tried were good but basically just completely hollow on the inside. For the price of the food and the vibe it looks like the restaurant is trying to give off, I just expected the food to be of better quality. Again, nothing was bad, but it just didn't impress any of us.

I took my 6 year-old daughter to this restaurant last night.  We had seared foie gras, bouillabaisse and kid's mac n cheese.  Seared foie gras was delicious.  Portion was big.  Bouillabaisse was very tasty.  The fish and shrimp were slightly over cooked but the broth was incredible.  Tons of seafood.  I also loved the ambiance.  Very bistro-like.  Service was excellent.  I would recommend for girl friends night out or causal date night.   A bit too quiet for kids or big family.

I'm only giving 3 stars because of the good service. We had Jose and he was full of jokes and smiles. The chicken and waffles was the most underwhelming I've ever had. Chicken was bland, dry, and not crispy at all. The waffles were limp and only good if drenched in syrup. The omelette was tasty, but super oily. I would not recommend this place and will not be returning.

Came for dinner with my wife for date night. Very nice ambiance and their custom drink menu is extensive. Had some appetizers and dinner. The ribeye was delicious. No sauce needed. There is a drizzle of honey around the plate and it actually was nice to give a little sweet touch to the salty crust of the steak. Spinach, mashed potatoes and green beans sides were good. Enough for 2 people to share. 

Overall, nice dinner/date spot. Would be good for a big group too as they have sections that look like they'd be fun for larger groups. My wife is a vegetarian, so the options were not as extensive as mine, but her risotto was good and the gnocchi is the next choice to try on our next visit.

A mainstay on the strip for over a decade at the Monte Carlo and now, hopefully, they'll be a mainstay in the southwest suburbs with their newly opened, more casual French bistro that took over the old DW Bistro space. The layout is pretty much unchanged, but the addition of dark wood accents and some modern lighting really make this space more intimate. 

While there are some traditional French dishes on the menu, the food is anything but old and stuffy. The sautéed foie gras is a modern dish paired with nutella brioche and strawberries to create an unforgettable combination of savory and sweet. For a more traditional dish, the braised lamb shank was a flawless execution of tender, fall off the bone meat over orzo pasta bathing in a rich, tomato based sauce. Their risotto is outstanding -- great firm texture to the rice, covered in a savory sauce and parmesan. I loved the flavors, presentation, and execution. The charcuterie board was an excellent display of house cured meats large enough to share with a few friends.

Less impressive were the gnocchi dish and mussels. The former was full of summer vegetables and ate more like a salad. The latter entree had some huge mussels that were too chewy and gritty.

Don't forget to ask about their specials. The first night I dined there they featured a lobster thermidor. While expensive, it was a beautiful display of buttery crustacean. 

I can never turn down dessert, and with a souffle on the menu I had to get it. They had both a grand marnier and a chocolate version. If you can't decide, like me, get the half and half. A light, fluffy souffle that showcased both flavors well. Another dessert, the dense, sweet chocolate gateau, was fantastic. Even though it was a relatively small slice it packed plenty of punch.

This is, without a doubt, a special place that's perfect for a date night or group gathering. Let's hope locals will fall in love with it and keep it around for years to come.

4.5 Stars

Reading Yelper's friends review, I was like I must try it! Great to know a French restaurant is 10mns away from home and away from the strip.
Location is great near Patrick and Fort Apache.
We decided to sit at the booth. Place is nice, charming. Waiters were pleasant. From our table I had a great panoramic of the restaurant and spacious patio. The bar well loaded and has a nice seating area.
It was our first time here so I called a friend to join for the happy hour 3pm to 6pm daily including weekend.
We ordered
- escargots de bourgogne persillés
- seared Foie Gras
- plateau de charcuterie
- salade lyonnaise with duck leg confit (in France the salade is with warm potato)
- onion soup
- soufflé half chocolate, half grand marnier

Escargot were ok, I added some salt to make it more tasty. I didn't taste the parsley butter at all :/
Charcuterie platter was well presented. Portion were too small. They could add some fresh grape fruits. Not sure if portion is smaller during Happy hour (saw other yelpers pics) the Pate was 1/4 of the one pictured on most pics posted :(
Seared foie gras was excellent ($24) and the salade lyonnaise as well. Salad dressing was delicious.
If you just want an onion soup for dinner, you might have to order 2... the portion is an appetizer portion.
The Souffle was good but little disappointed. I couldn't taste the good french chocolate at all. CPK chocolate soufflé is even tastier 

My experience was mitigé (half/half). Super happy to have a nice french close by.
The staff was nice and on top of it.
We booked a table at 5:30pm to enjoy the happy hour. It would be nice to make a last call on happy hours.
I just noticed they did not apply the happy hours on 2 items :/ not cool!

If you are looking for something different in the Valley, why not try afternoon tea at Andre's, Saturday & Sunday's. Starts at 10:30 am, reservations suggested. The food is excellent & the pastries are heavenly. Service is superb as always.
Great traditional French cuisine.  Cheese and charcuterie plate was perfect--great pate.

I have had two meals here and on both occasions encountered some critical missteps....bland mussels, soggy frizze, underdone poached egg, duck confit tasted like it had been reheated, charcuterie did not include any cured meats...just sausage and terrine with the cheeses.  Drinks are good...ambiance is nice...they just need to get that kitchen on point.

Ok I got food poisoning the next day...had to be the duck...it tasted old and was lukewarm.

Decided to check Andre's out since we heard and read good things about the place. We like the casual feel of the room and we're greeted in a friendly manner. 

Started out with a Calamari appetizer which was very good, though a relatively small portion. That doesn't very much concern us...if you want big portions go to Claim Jumpers. 

There then seemed to be a delay and while waiting for our entrees we noticed that no one in the restaurant was being served...kinda weird, but ultimately our plates arrived. The Artisanal Housemade Sausages were very good and they brought mustard and pickles on the side.   Moules Frites consisted of very meaty mussels in a delicious sauce but 1) there were no tomatoes in the tomato concasse...we pointed it out and they brought them out from the kitchen, 2) the duck fat fries that came with were room temperature, 3) they provided no small fork for easier access to the mussels 4) they provided no plate or bowl for the mussel shells. 

Andre's is not overly expensive but neither is it cheap so I expected a little more. But we'll certainly give them another shot since the food quality is high.

I love: the burger, the quiche Lorraine, the croque madame, the petals and pears cocktail. I love this place and it has become one of my favorite lunch and dinner spots near home. The house baked pastries are also wonderful and authentic. They have real croissants! Yay!

Andre's Bistro & Bar is located at the previous DW Bistro's location.  The layout is almost identical yet the ambience is a markedly improved with richer, deeper tones....French Bistro tones, if you will.

While the dinner experience is rather sexy and romantic, lunch time is upbeat and casual. I have been in multiple times for both lunch and dinner. On my latest visit, my girlfriend and I came in for lunch and ordered the Lobster Roll and Cobb Salad. The Lobster Roll was well seasoned, with chunks of Lobster wrapped up with warm, crispy bread.  It came with garlic French fires...I wish I would have asked to substitute with a salad, as I'm not much of a fry eater. The Cobb Salad showed up with bountiful amounts of bacon and chicken. My friend loved her salad very much. Our waiter brought us a warm baguette and butter as we finished our meals...almost felt like an after thought.

All the dishes I've had over 4 times visits has been nothing but delicious. I would like to come on a Wednesday for their mid-week brunch between 10am to 3:30pm.

I am both proud and grateful that Vegas locals have chef Rochart and his team off the strip and in this neighborhood. 

-2017 review #52-

Well, where do I even begin!!! And I wish was saying that because my experience was great, but it was FAR from great. It was actually ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. 

My sister made our Mother's Day reservation via OpenTable for 6pm. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and we were seated WITHOUT any menus. Waited about 10 mins before a waiter came with the menus. Not sure if our waiter even introduced himself. 
We ordered some appetizers while we waited for the rest of our party. When they brought us our waters they mentioned that they would bring us bread. Mind you that we had already been sitting there for quite some time. 
Appetizers came still no bread and butter and two glasses on the table didn't have any water. We had to ask for bread  since they never brought it in the first place. We finished our appetizers and still no bread so we asked for it once AGAIN. 
We began ordering our main courses and to our surprise there were a few items that were no longer available. (At most other restaurants, when items are not available waiters let guests know beforehand, like when they are seated, so that the guests can find other options.) 
Ok, so we've placed our orders and the bread FINALLY got to the table. They couldn't even get that right! We were an 8 top and they serve one half of the loaf (serves about 5 people)! Are you kidding me! We had to ask for more bread! 
The first of the main entrees finally get to the table- they served the kid's chicken fingers and fries and the rest of the table had to wait about another 5-10 minutes before for their food. Of course the orders were messed up. Cobb Salad, which you would assume is a lot easier to make than steaks, arrived LAST! I personally ordered the Flat Iron Steak with béarnaise sauce, cooked medium, and a side of mashed potatoes. BUT I got a WELL DONE steak mashed potatoes and NO sauce. Also, typically when you order steaks, the waiter brings steak knives but just ANOTHER thing we as the diners had to ask for! Oh the reason for my steak being OVERCOOKED?!? Apparently it was sitting under the heat lamp too long! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?! WHAT KIND OF HEAT LAMPS ARE THEY USING!!!! They said they were going to re-cook the steak but at this point I was so anger that this was the experience that I lost my appetite completely. 
They served the filet steak medium rare when it was asked to be cooked medium with a side of mushrooms- of course they didn't get the side right for that either! Instead of mushrooms they brought mashed potatoes! WHAT ELSE CAN GO WRONG!!!!! 
FINALLY, I go find the manager to let him know what's going on. He was going to fix the problem by offering free desserts but at that point we all just really wanted to leave! 
We were seated next to a family who had to be friends or family of one of the waiters so of course they were attended to without any problems. .
THE BEST of all the excuses!!!! Our waiter told us that they had been there all day and that were short staffed- what an excuse for the WORSE SERVICE I HAVE EXPERIENCED!
(Mind you my family and I eat out at plenty of different restaurants all over the city and this by FAR IS THE WORST!) 
I would normally say I would give Andre's Bistro another try, but after everything that happened I AM ABSOLUTELY TURNED OFF. 

I have NEVER EVER jrefused my food be remade. I normally let them fix the mistake BUT this was not going to fix anything. Between the wait time, having to ask our waiter for everything, and messing up on orders. I was over this place!!!!! 

SUCH A SHAME! 

I hope that they figure their issues out and I hope that their waiters come up with better excuses!

We walked in on a busy Sunday morning. This place was filled with people and seemed so promising. Our server was kind and cheerful and seemed eager to serve us. 

 First bad part, we were sat down in the middle of two other tables when there were other tables that were open. The people to our left seemed to be planning a bridal shower and were talking loudly. I came to eat a good brunch, not listen to other people's plans. 

Then, the food took some time to arrive and honestly, it looks way better than it tastes. We ordered the lobster roll, chicken and waffles, and also the chocolate soufflé which added up to about $50. A friend recommended this place so we had high expectations and we felt nothing but disappointment. The lobster roll was covered in mayo, and seemed more like a lobster slaw inside a bread bun if anything. The waffles were super doughy and soft and the sauce made it even worse. The chicken wasn't crunchy what so ever. It was super mushy and I believe it was the sauces fault also. In my opinion, replacing the sauce with maple syrup on the side would have helped make it somewhat better. The soufflé was just nothing special. 

The sad part about it all, was that the complimentary bread and butter tasted better than the meals we had ordered. 

There was also a server walking around, asking different tables if what he was carrying was their order. Sir, you should know where you are bringing your food to. 

Not planning on coming here ever again and would not recommend anyone to either.

We had a nice welcome when we walked in and great service at the bar. We started off with these crispy fried frog legs and duck fat fries. We had the mushroom risotto and the Andre Burger for dinner. We ended with the Gran Marnier Soufflé, recommended by the Bartender. It was scrumptious.  Every bit of it was 5 stars. We will be back!
Excellent bistro. Lamb shank incredible!!  Loved the Grand Marnier Soufflé.  Enjoyed the ambience and the service. Ricotta gnocchi was novel with witty green pea purée.

I will start by saying SOME of the food was tasty however, service was incredibly slow. We were dining with kids and every other restaurant makes sure to at least try and have kids food out first however, the kids waited just as extremely long to get their food as everyone else.
