Our server asked if we were going to wait to have our food come out so we could continue to enjoy the appetizer we ordered so we he kids wouldn't starve and when I replied that we would like the food, he stated it would be right out ...20 mins later, still no food. It is a shame because there was definite potential here however, the staff seemed confused and were not very efficient. There was no effort to apologize for the long wait times or to even offer anything for the kids who were quite audibly saying "we are starving". Once the food finally did come out, it came out one separated dish at a time with the kids food last. Though our wait was over, sadly our disappointment did not end there. 

The food:

French toast: brought out cold. When we sent it back, they microwaved it then walked around confused unsure of which table it went to taking it first to a different table (they sat it down in front of a different person) before picking it back up, going back to the kitchen to figure out where to take it. Once three staff discussed the conundrum, they finally brought the nuked, rubbery, dry French toast back over to our table.

Veggie quiche with side salad: they should change this to side lettuce. A plate full of mixed greens with scarce dressing. The quiche was lukewarm but had a good flavor. 
Kids mac and cheese: this was an adult dish that was put on a kids menu. Most kids don't like 5 different kinds of gourmet cheeses and as a result this dish was a fail. A bubbly pile of cheese with macaroni buried inside was not a hit with the kids.

The beignets, French onion soup, and charcuterie plate were very good. 

Overall, extremely long wait for food, one person in our party got nothing, and  we had to take the kids to lunch after lunch. We even had a delay getting our check and had to enlist the assistance of another server since ours was dealing with yet another complaint and computer confusion. There is potential if they figure out their servers but I won't be back any time soon. 

Note: there was also a circulating gentleman with a beard who appeared to be a manager but I wouldn't know since he made no effort to check on anyone even when they were visible distressed.

Finally! A French bistro that's near home, where I can grab escargot and risotto without breaking the bank or sucking the life out of my gas tank. The ambiance is classy, the food is amazing, and the service is excellent.

We had the escargot, beet salad, and vegetable turrine for starters. All delicious, all well seasoned. With the Complimentary fresh baguette, the escargot fish was left white and shiny.

Lobster roll and iron steak were amazing. I'd definitely come here again and again...And again!

Came here for a friends Birthday and am so happy I got to discover this gem! Staff are so lovely, food is amazing and the atmosphere was perfect. Love this place and was recommended by another guest to come back for their brunch. I definitely will :)

Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, I've only been here for brunch and lunch, haven't had the chance to try the dinner menu but I can't complain about anything! Service is awesome, the food is amazing and the ambiance is great!!!

Thank you Chef Rochat !  You have hit it out of the park.  I have been enjoying Andre's since the early 90's downtown.  My wife and I have visited both locations at the Monte Carlo and Palms several times since they opened.  The menu is great and new.  They also have the classic menu with the pricing very reasonable.  We had the charcuterie platter and crispy calamari as an appetizer, I had the risotto which was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of tooth resistance, perfect flavoring and a larger than expected portion. My friend had the lobster roll and she was extremely happy with that. I will definitely be back at Andres Bistro and Bar.
Michael was wonderful! This place is great! We sat on the patio and it was so nice and relaxing! I would highly recommend the trout,  it was so delicious! I am definitely coming back!
The food was really good! My wife had the clams and I had the lamb burger, both of which were delicious! We'll definitely be back!
This might be the best restaurant off the strip.  Try the foie gras and the lamb shank, sooo good.

If you like French bistros and great food you need to go here. You will not be disappointed. Excellent onion soup. Great tasting beet salad. Lamb shanks perfectly cooked.  Flatiron steak is correctly prepared  and is cooked to order. I recommend the lemon tart for dessert. Excellent service. One of the best meals I have had in quite a while.

Literally my favorite restaurant in Vegas. the food is incredible, all of it; oysters, seafood, steaks, not a bad thing on the menu. The staff is incredible, waiters and bartenders know what they are talking about and provide incredible service. you can order the food to your home as well. there is not one thing i would change about this place. amazing.
This place was great service is great he name was nick . The salad was great we had the lobster roll for lunch very price is fair . We recommend it

Located in the Old DW bistro spot, much better and cleaner looking. 
The service at lunch was just ok needs a little work, we went for lunch and the server didn't really know the menu. The food however was very good! everything we tried was fresh and had good flavor. Good french food off the strip! we will be back.

Great food, great wine and great service! Ricardo was our waiter, friendly, prompt and attentive. Ordered frog legs (first time ever having them, found them wonderfully crispy and tender), trout almandine (delicious sauce, moist fish) and beet salad (light, crispy first course). Will definitely be back!

Updated review for Restaurant Week 2018.
I selected Andre's for the three course restaurant week dinner because the menu was a tribute to Anthony Bourdain.
Appetizer - Escargot
Entree - Duck a l orange
Dessert - Chocolate Walnut Gateau

We had reservations and seated immediately. The dining room was nearly filled. Our server Nate was on point. He took our cocktail order right after we were seated and in a few minutes after the cocktails arrived he took our dinner order and provided a loaf of bread with butter, olive oil and balsamic.
The escargots, six to an order were plump and tender in a tasty garlic herb butter sauce. The bread was perfect to sop up the sauce. Yum

The duck breast was cooked medium rare, sliced and sitting on a bed of spinach and  along side the dauphinoise potato cake with duck confit topped with orange slices. Surrounding the plate was a pool of gravy. Wow it was a rich brown delicious gravy.

The chocolate walnut gateau  was chocolate glazed caramel, walnut torte with crème anglaise. A marvelous finish.

A minor glitch during the evening was that a side order of green beans was not delivered with the entree and arrived later after our server was advised. Removal of empty plates was slow which appeared to be the need for additional support staff as the servers were working flat out.

It was good but not great to where I would drive out of my way to dine there again. Maybe happy hour when the prices are cut in half. 

I came here twice in three days-- once for dinner the second for brunch. I'll start with dinner. 

My boyfriend says I'm in too much of a rush, but I just felt like service was sooooo slow. I'm all for having a nice sit-down meal but I think the first impression should be that you're getting the ball rolling as soon as the guests sit down. I had the salmon which was cooked perfectly with a side of mashed potatoes. The potatoes left little to be desired and were disappointing. My boyfriend had a filet cooked medium, but it came out medium well+. It was also really thin. When I think of a filet I think of a small but thick cut-- this one was simply flat. For dessert we ordered the apple tart which was underwhelming. We expected more of a crust which is usually the star, but there was hardly any which made us both pick at the apples and leave it alone. 

On to brunch. My latte took a while to come out, and a left it unfinished which I can honestly say I've never done to a cup of coffee/espresso before. There was hardly any foam or steamed milk. The chicken & waffles were weird. The waffle is a cornmeal waffle (not expressed in the menu or else I wouldn't have ordered it) and it comes loaded with gravy. It was good, but not what you think of when ordering this particular dish. My boyfriend's eggs Benedict was so tiny. I'm not looking for American super-sized portions, but everything comes out meek and disappointing. Our dirty plates sat in front of us for a while before they were cleared. 

The salmon was so good, and there were so many other desserts that sounded fantastic, that I think I need to give this place another chance before I decided whether or not this is going to be a regular place I visit.

This review is for 4.5 stars. 

Andre's really impressed me. I had never been to the strip restaurant but when I heard this place had opened I had to try it. The sausage omelette was one of top 5 omelettes I have ever had. Ingredients inside were generously portioned and perfectly cooked. The accompanied potatoes were great with a sautéed onion extra included. Accompany that with $25 bottomless mimosas and you'll surely enjoy your meal. The best part is brunch lasts until 3:30pm so your mimosas won't go to waste even if you get a late start to your Saturday or Sunday. 

The only couple of things knocking this review down from a 5 is the bread tasted a little stale/hard and the waiter disappeared for times. He was great when he came around and was very nice, but we couldn't track him down when it came time to order some extras like hot sauce or drinks. 

But overall this is one of the better brunches in town and for sure the best in the southwest.

I am in town for work and am tired and didn't feel like going out.  I was pleasantly surprised to find something other than Chinese or Pizza to order for delivery, especially since I love French food!!! I ordered the Lobster Roll with duck fat fries and the French onion soup ( which I was certain would be a terrible take out item) and it was ALL FABULOUS!!! I'm in town tomorrow night as well and am already craving the soup and looking forward to a frisée salad and seared Foie Gras!

We went here for the first time on a Sunday for brunch. I am so glad to see some of these more unique and fun places start making there way to the local areas of town. Having to trek down to the strip for a Brunch is annoying. This was a breath of fresh air. 

We were seating in what seemed like overflow seating. It was where they may host catering events, etc. I am mentioning this because there were glass racks everywhere and this is where a kitchen door was. Not the most appetizing area to be seating but I can understand why they do it. 

We started with mimosas and bloody Mary's. We did not get the "bottomless" option but they're available for a few of their drinks. We then ordered beignets. They were so yummy! Piping hot too. 

We ordered eggs benny, croque madame, and chicken and waffles. They were all delicious! Their fries are fried in fuck fat...need I say more? One issue here; the fried chicken with the waffles was very spicy. There was no mention of this on the menu (that we can recall) and it would have been nice to know in advance. The person eating it is not one who enjoys spicy. 

We will be back. Pricing was totally reasonable!
Fantastic burgers! Duck fat fries  were BOMB!!! A great experience all around honestly!

Great for brunch! Food is tasty and staff is very friendly and attentive! Bottomless mimosas and great Bloody Mary. 

Edit: 5/27/18, We are always so surprised we are able to just walk into this place on Sunday's. Everything we have ever ordered from here has always been really tasty, I had ordered a King Crab Benedict with avocado instead of asparagus and man it's one of the best Benedict's I've had! The staff as always is very attentive and friendly!

What an amazing new addition to the SW! Had the feel of a neighborhood restaurant. Intimate and inviting. Dani was our server and she was knowledgeable and funny and attentive. I had the wild mushroom risotto (the only Veg option on the menu unfortunately) and it was delicious. I hope they will increase that selection on their menu at some point. The portions are large and the sides are perfect to share between two! 
Looking forward to checking out their happy hour!!

We decided to give this place a try for my friends sending off before deployment brunch. The decor is nice and simple and they have a spacious covered patio. We opted to sit outside since it was a nice breezy day. At first the waitress seemed standoffish but after some time she warmed up to us. 

We ordered beignets as appetizers and they were heavenly! Light and fluffy just how they should be made. They have two all you can drink options 1) is mimosas for 24 pp and 2) is the henny sangria for 25 pp. I thought if I paid 25 I could get either or for a nice little mix but I was sadly mistaken. Although the difference is only a dollar, you cannot mix between the two even if you opt to pay the more expensive option. Maybe they should include that as a choice for those looking to experience both.

Now I know you are reading this thinking wow, why only 3 stars everything seems great so far. Well, it's because of my main course. I ordered the Steak Frites and while presentation was to die for the steak was BEYOND bland! Not even the garlic butter on top could make up for it. Having a steak look so marvelous and be so tasteless is really an enigma. Fries were nice and crunchy but could not save this dish. 

My friend ordered a lobster roll and enjoyed his food very much. Other friend had the chicken and waffles which he states wasn't very special.

I really wanted to like this place and have a new brunch spot but it looks like I will continue my search!

We had a large party for a birthday celebration and there was a preset menu. Everything was great until the orders came in and the dishes were ordered wrong. We kept telling the waiter that this was not what we ordered and he argued with us for 10min. Worst service ever. Will never come back!
Lobster roll is great!  The service was bad.  It took over 30 minutes to get our food.

We are an insta fan! It's been a while since I have written a 5 stars review. We came to Andre's for early dinner today. We sat outside on the patio. The restaurant is chic, and tastefully decorated.

The service was really great. The waiter made sure our waters and cocktails/ drinks were filled. We ordered most of the items from the happy hour menu. Happy hour is from 3pm to 5.30pm. The menu is unique which I like. We had the Charcuterie Board, everything on it were really delicious. The escargot was really flavorful with  tons of garlic and butter. We also ordered Frog legs, although the batter was heavy, it was meaty. We ordered Andre's burger to take home. Don't forget to order the house cocktails, it was also delicious. The bill was about $87 and $104 with tips for a happy hour meal but it was worth it. 

Overall, the food portion was not small and the quality was excellent and so was the service and experience. We will definitely be back.

Had date night here last night, wasn't super disappointed but also not really impressed. Our server Nate was really attentive but also allowed us to enjoy our meal without bombarding our table every 5 minutes. We sat further back in the restaurant which was nice because it was still light outside and there are a lot of windows in the front - being tucked back there was a darker and more intimate.

Started off with the charcuterie plate. And a couple glasses of the Sonoma Chard. I'm not joking the meat + cheese portion was soooo small. One roll of prosciutto, and two slices of the thinnest coppa I've ever seen, there was a nice amount of the duck pate (my personal fav) so that was nice. Cheese - blue cheese, taleggio (so yum but just not enough), and the other two were firmer cheeses' and clearly not memorable. There were more toppings (d. mustard, cornichons) then there was meat + cheese. So there's that.

For entrees we both choose the Cobb (salads aren't my usual choice but it was super hot outside and I wanted greens) comes with grilled chicken. I expected it to be warm and sliced chicken. But it was cold and in chunks, which makes me question its freshness. My bf subbed the chicken for steak, cooked to a perfect med-rare temp. Surprisingly the up-charge for the steak was only $6 (about 4oz filet) 

I do really like the bar area. I'd return for drinks and different apps with girlfriends. But def pass on dinner next time.

Jose was our server. He wasn't pleasant by the end of our dining experience.  My husband and I went for Saturday Brunch. He gave small joking remarks when I said I will just have water for drinks and when I paid for the meal at the end of the meal, he tossed the check with my $71 change attached on the table as he walked by and kept walking. Jose the waiter made us feel unwanted at Andre's Bistro.

My husband ordered iron steak medium well, It was well done.  I ordered eggs Benedict and French toast with WATER.  We always give 20% tip but today was only 10% thanks to our waiters attitude throwing my money on the table without a word.  Now I feel that was too much.  We definitely won't be back.

Excellent food. However the service is extremely slow.  2 to 21/2 hours for appetizer,entree and desert.  A little too leisurely for me.  Appetizers are enormous you should share. Entrees are not.  I will be back.

You must go here for weekend Brunch and have their beignets. They are delicious. The escargot is quite good also and they have unlimited booze during brunch on the weekends in the form of mimosas, rose and I some kind of special cocktail du jour.

Absolutely awesome happy hour! $2 off wine, $2 off cocktails, $2 off well drinks, $1 off beer and food specials. Had a glass of sparkling rose, the house burger, and the creme brûlée. All were fantastic. For 2 drinks, 2 burgers, and a dessert, the bill was only $35 including tip. We will be back for sure!

What a delightful place. My wife and I came on a lazy Sunday afternoon and the service was flawless. The food is excellent.

I had the lamb burger with duck fries. It was perfect. Even the ketchup was amazing.

My wife had the beet salad and she thought it was good.

The bread is a treat and I highly recommend the indulgence before the main meal.

I highly recommend Andre's, you won't regret it!

This is a wonderful little bistro! I was in the area for business and enjoyed my first meal so much that I went back for a second time.  The Thai chicken burger and duck fat french fries were wonderful and the Grand Marnier soufflé was fantastic! They have a creative and generous happy hour menu. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in the Vegas area.

Came here this afternoon for brunch with some girlfriends. The overall atmosphere is decent, the decor is cute, and the food was not good. I ordered the French onion soup as a starter and it was bad. The cheese part was good but past that, the rest of the soup was too salty and it had some very harsh herbs that made it taste bitter. The waffles were not my favorite, the were very very very hard. Every bite made me feel like I was biting into cardboard. The pieces were so hard to chew and the syrup slipped right off of them because there was nothing to absorb the liquid due to the firmness of the waffle. The service was average, its hard to judge service on a larger party especially because some people in our party were late so the server had to keep coming back and wasn't sure how long to wait to come back each time to see if we were ready yet. Not her fault, so can't really speak on how the regular service is. Probably wouldn't come back due to the fact that the food just wasn't impressive at all. Wouldn't definitely recommend you skip this place when southwest has sooo many other brunch places that are incredible.

This was our first time here and we did the Restaurant Week lunch.  I had the creamy potato truffle soup to start, followed by the trout almondine with haricot verts and ended with the creme brulee. 
The soup was fantastic. Creamy with great texture and truffly without being too truffly. The  trout was perfectly cooked and very moist. The haricot verts were also well cooked with some crunch left in them. The custard of the creme brulee was silky smooth and the berries on top were very fresh. The only thing I would improve was the bruleed top could have been a bit thicker for some added crunch.
The staff was very friendly and attentive from the host that greeted us to the bartender waited on us. The assisting staff that delivered our food and bussed our table was also friendly and helpful.
We are looking forward to returning for Happy Hour or dinner.

After reading positive comments from a local food critic, I decided to go and visit the new bistro.
The host was very accommodating, polite, super courteous an overall great guy.
We are a party of 4, we ordered 2 escargot appetizer and was surprised to find them very salty, we told our waiter and he quickly returned the escargots to the kitchen, after a few minutes he brought them back and we noticed that the escargot sauce was white sauce instead of garlic butter, the chef has added cream to the dish to tone down the excessive salt, it's was awful and also the dish was cold, the manager returned the escargot to the kitchen to reheat, he personally brought back the dish and was very apologetic, we all tasted the escargot and by now I could have used it to patch a hole in my car tire.
The fries where also cold and that was exchanged, they of course removed the escargot charges from our bill.
Overall, the place is nice, maybe that was a bad day as they just opened and are used to the tourist versus local crowed, I'll give them another couple month and then retry again..
We are foodies, we don't have the luxury of being recognized as some local food critics that get great tasting food.

My second lunch here,  hubby's first. Everything was delicious and service excellent. From the sweet butter and warm mini baguette, veggie terrine starter, Frisee salad with duck Condit, lamb burger to chocolate shuffle dessert.  To for for duck fat fries. No ketchup for those fries for me, they ate way too tasty on their own.
Can't wait to try dinner here.

Food is amazing. We had a daily special beef bourguignon and it was delicious. Their desserts are to die for. 
Definitely coming back again.

I am a local and I can highly recommend Andre's Bistro & Bar. The food is very, very good! My wife & I each had the Coq au vin and it was excellent. The side of green beans with almonds was also excellent. We were there for Andre's Happy Hour from 3-6 p.m. and the prices were low for the high quality of the food. The Happy Hour prices for wine were very reasonable. Andre's is on Ft. Apache in the Spring Valley area, so it is a drive from the Strip, however I think it is worth the drive (the drive is reasonable) if you are looking for a high-quality meal at reasonable prices rather than one of the expensive restaurants on the Strip. And if you are a visitor to Las Vegas, you will get to see some of the suburban area of Las Vegas by driving to Andre's. The atmosphere is very nice, and comfortably casual, with very good service (our server Kenny was really good!). Andre's is right off of Ft. Apache and parking is easy. Pete Scalisi

had lunch today w friends
coq au vin and gigondas for wine
i eat all around las vegas and this is probably one of the best value i have encountered so far...
check their lunch, happy hour and diner menu...
good for both low budget or more
i will be back soon w friends
very impressed...
andre is the type of chef who cant retire because he loves his craft.....
he owns alizee at the palm tower, one of the best restaurant in las vegas....
no wonder....

Sadly, I have been to Andre's 3 times prior to yesterday. Enjoyed it every time. That was why I chose the location for a special birthday lunch for my best friend. I made reservations several days prior.
We arrived right on time and were shown to a very small table for 2 when there were plenty of larger tables available. Women need room to put their purses, instead of settling for the floor!
They no longer had a separate lunch menu. It's the same menu for dinner.
If I want to pay $100.00 for 2 for lunch (I drank water, my friend had 1 beer), I will go to the Strip.
I asked not to rush the second course, but was still eating my first course when the 2nd arrived. We had to ask for their French bread. The server said we didn't want any!!  We never did. No birthday acknowledgement. I won't return.

I rarely find myself saying 5 stars, because everyone and everything can always be better. But when it comes to a restaurant experience, if the service , food, price all balance each other, I am bowled! Their regular drip coffee was great. I had the egg white omelette which was so flavorful with the sausage and veggies. Their daily special was crispy waffle with duck and foiegras. Simply delectable. The walnut chocolate gateau and pot de creme were a great finish.

Four of us met to enjoy brunch at Andre's this past Saturday morning.  Chef De Leon Lopez was given carte blanche to cook for the table.  The dishes served were:

Baguette with farm butter.
Beignets.
House made pastries.
Escargots de Bourgogne. 
Charcuterie platter.
Brown sugar glazed bacon.
Classic eggs Benedict.
Andre's salmon Benedict.
Croque madame.
Quiche Lorraine.
Vegetable quiche.
Chicen and waffles.
Foie gras.
Lobster roll with fries.
Lobster roll with salad.
Flatiron steak frites.
Lemon tart.
Sunday sundae.
Root beer float.
Walnut cake.
Crème brûlée.

There wasn't one thing on this list I wouldn't recommend.  This was my first time to Andre's new spot and I was blown away.  Even the chicken and waffles were very, very good!  I will point out a few things I would order again.  Without a doubt, I'd get the foie gras, the lobster roll with fries, escargots, beignets, and the lemon tart.  For me, those were the standouts.

Service was excellent.  Water glasses were constantly refilled and our coffee cups never wanted for refilling.

Now that I've had the brunch offerings, it will soon be time to go back for dinner service,  It's great having a French restaurant that's a quick 10 minute drive from home.

Absolutely great flavor and presentation. Nathaniel was our server and he was very attentive and helpful. Fruit is fresh as well as the sautéed spinach was amazing. Our group had a view different item ranging from duck to mussels to steak and eggs. Everyone was satisfied. PLUS they have bottomless drinks (select menu) till 3pm . I've came for brunch multiple times and it was awesome each time

Deal with drive to the strip---Nope
Deal with parking and walking 1/2 mile--Nope

Andrés has it going on..and then some! Great execution for "Simple Food" makes a great experience.
French Onion Soup- great flavor, consistent cuts on the onion, cooks consistently....again...great execution and attention to detail.

Frissee Salad- transported me back to the small Bouchons in France...thank you bringing such amazing food memories

Escargot Provencal- great combination  of garlic, butter and fresh herbs....how can you go wrong?!?!

Thank you so much for opening this amazing restaurant....if great chefs continue  this trend of leaving the strip and opening great eateries  like this in the suburbs ...who knows...Las Vegas might actually create "Culinary Soul"

Enjoyed a lovely Saturday brunch! 

Hubby and I popped in on a Saturday at 11:30 and it was pretty quiet. There were only about 3-4 tables. I had a scrumptious Bloody Mary and he had a sazerac. 

We shared the mussels with duck fat fries and the lobster roll with green salad as we were in the mood for savory lunch vs. the sweets. There were lots of options on the menu. These two dishes were excellent! Fries were divine. Mussels were tender and flavorful and huge. I honestly didn't love having to bite into them but it's not their fault they got giant mussels. The lobster roll was generous for the price and tasted fresh and scrumptious on the buttery roll. 

We were stuffed so we didn't make it to a soufflé or beignets despite our interest. Our bill was $62 which I thought was very reasonable for cocktails and nice seafood. Additionally, they had a Groupon at the time so it really was a steal!  Ambiance is nice and service was excellent. 

We would certainly return for another meal service or brunch again.

Go eat, enjoy, laugh, weep at the beauty of every dish, swoon over the complexity of every bite. Get the mussels, feast on the duck sausage, melt with the creme brulee. Treat yourself to this divine experience, the price is reasonable, the value is extraordinary
All team is friendly and they make me and my family feel special. The waitress girl is sweetheart and got great hospitality attitude. Food expensive but it's savings my trip to strip for nice food.
Great food, cooked perfectly. Definitely worth the wait. The roasted chicken was moist and the skin was crispy to perfection. I will definitely come back to try other options.

My go to spot in the neighborhood! 

I first came for the happy hour, sat the bar, and enjoyed the signature burger which was fantastic, and a real bargain at $7. Tim was the bar keep at the time, his service was excellent and was the reason for my return actually. On my second go I met Cameron who is the other bar keep, and is a true craftsman of cocktails. I shared a few ingredients and he proceeded to make me one of the most balanced cocktails I've had from this request. The service from both of these guys is second to none, and the fact that they turn out some solid drinks is a bonus. If you visit venture out from your typical vodka soda and you should be pleased. The food is excellent, i have not had a bad meal here. If i had to pick my fav's so far i dig that signature burger with that marmalade, and the gnocchi is a solid dish as well. I will state my only small issue and i hope it gets addressed but there has been a lack of consistency. The fries are different on occasion, and I've had different buns on my hamburgers (like wonder buns). If your ironing out the kinks, just know you had it right form the start, don't change a thing. 

If you live in the Southwest you are doing it wrong if you're still going to PT's to eat. Come down, give it a try....just save room for me at the bar.

I was expecting more from my meal, especially given early rave reviews, but brunch fell flat.

Andre's Bistro and Bar is a fairly new location in Southwest Las Vegas carrying on the French cuisine of a local institution that used to be on the Strip for a time, and reportedly started out downtown a few decades ago. I was invited to brunch with several Yelp friends and leapt at the chance to try out what really should have been a better meal.

Drip Coffee ($3): good coffee, not that much bitterness, enjoyed it just fine as a black unsweetened coffee as I am wont to do these days, but I had to ask for refills twice before getting more coffee.

Bread with butter (complimentary): a very promising start, with an exceptional sliced baguette and a puck of creamy butter. It was confusing that only part of the table received this offering at the start, while the rest of us had to bide our time until around the arrivals of the appetizers/sides, but it was well worth the wait.

Duck Fat Fries (unsure of side dish price, was grazing on a friend's): the texture was reasonable good, but you'll definitely taste duck fat in every bite. Garlic was also plentiful. Ketchup was standard and came in a relatively small amount; fortunately, it wasn't necessary

Escargots de Bourgogne ($12): six snails served in those ceramic circular plates with indentations. Very good flavors from the herbs and garlic butter and not too chewy. The extra sauce complemented the complimentary baguette quite well too. Despite the cost, I'd order it again.

Andres Classic Benedict ($14): I enjoyed this in the moment, but it really feels like a small portion compared to similarly priced eggs Benedict at similar local spots. The Benedict was tasty and the yolk was runny, but the English muffin was unremarkable and the ham was especially sparse considering how thinly it was sliced. I had to do some excessive manipulation to get ham onto every quarter portion of the muffin. The potatoes were quite awesome, but a side dish does not a great entree make (and the potato portion was also small compared to something like Kitchen Table).

Chicken and Waffles ($16 on menu, but $14 on receipt): flavors were mostly right, although I just couldn't figure out how the (delicious, by the way) Southern-style gravy was supposed to be compatible with the syrup. The main issue is that the dish fell flat on textures. The fried chicken batter had the feel of flour, which shouldn't happen at all even if it's made of flour. The chicken itself was oddly too tender - not mushy, but it just didn't have the heft of being meat. The waffles - love the cornbread composition, by the way - could've been a little more crisp.

Chocolate Pot De Creme ($8): pretty good dessert. Smooth throughout, in both the chocolate and the cream topping. Didn't fall into the trap of tasting like boxed chocolate pudding, which was an issue at another local restaurant but the chocolate could be richer and/or darker. The vanilla "cookie" garnish was a bit ephemeral, but fun, and the mint garnish was nice but overpowering if actually eaten.

Grand Marnier Souffle ($12): great dessert overall. Fluffy, lemony, tableside presentation including a hole poked into the top and cream poured into that indentation. Pricey, but likely worth it if you're a fan of the dessert.

Small aforementioned issues aside, service was reasonable. There was a 18% auto-gratuity for our larger group. The receipt has an offer for 10% off lunch (Mon-Fri 11:30am-3:30pm) for a group of up to 6. Decor was welcoming enough, and televisions presumably can be tuned to major sporting competitions, although I wouldn't call ESPN's coverage of college softball that much of a must-see event.

Whether it was flaws in execution (such as the decidedly non-bleu cooking temperature of my tablemate's burger) or overarching recipe issues, my particular meal at Andre's Bistro and Bar did not meet my high expectations. Thus, I can't say that "I'm a fan," although I'd rate my experience 3.5 stars if that were possible on Yelp. That said, I'll keep the place in mind for a revisit because of the praise I've heard and read for other menu items.

My husband and I came here for happy hour on a Friday as I've heard great reviews and rants and raves about this place from family and fellow locals. 

We ordered the escargot, Andre's burger, charcuterie board, salad with balsamic vinaigrette. Everything was fantastic. Will definitely be back for the escargot- which was my favorite. Their escargot is THE BEST IN TOWN! I've tried escargot from a few high end restaurants at the strip but Andre's serves the best!

Wow! It's been a long time since I've been this impressed by a restaurant! I don't give 5 stars often, but Chef Andre and his team deserve it. 
We have been wanting to check Andre's out since it opened, and finally went  yesterday for Restaurant Week, which supports Three Square. The Restaurant Week menu was a tribute to Anthony Bourdain, who we really love and miss. Wife had the French Onion soup and the Duck a l'Orange while I went with the  Beef Carpaccio and Steak Frites. We both had the Creme Brulee for dessert.
The soup was so deliciously cheesy! You could not pull the spoon out without strands of cheese following. The carpaccio was also very good, with the highlight being the parmesan and smoked sea salt.
MY wife had never tried Duck a l'Orange before, and the one time I had it was disappointing. This was absolutely amazing!!! The flavor and tenderness of the duck was perfect. Almost melted in your mouth. She also loved the potatoes with the duck confit. 
The flat iron steak was very tender and surprising thick, even though it was just a bit past my requested medium rare, and even better when dipped in the bearnaise sauce. The duck fat fries were to die for! Hands down the best fries I've ever had. Then again, I've never had duck fat fries before. 
I'm not big on sweets, but I actually finished the Creme Brulee! Perfect balance of sweet and savory for me (yes, I watch way too much Food Network!). My wife said it was the best she'd ever had.
So glad we finally went, and we look forward to going again.
It is a charming little restaurant with great food and good waiters.  I love the music and decor. I have been here twice and each time everything was delicious.

Restaurant Week is really a great way to eat for a cause. Tonight we went to Andre's
Delicious food and good service. 
Had Chocolatte Souffle bouillabaisse, muscles with duck fat fries, everything was above my expectation... ans the music really sets the mood.
The newest Andre's Bistro just opened and is well worth the wait! Killer Lobster Roll and great wine list! Not to mention the friendly staff and warm ambiance!

Andre's has been a part of this city for so many years, having this location so close to where we live is a treat. Great staff, amazing food, in the true spirit of what Andre's has always been about. Exceeded our expectations tonight.

I am struggling a bit in giving Andre's a solid score, I wish they allow half stars. So based on the average score I'm giving them on customer service and food I've come to 3 stars. Here's why....


Customer service 2 stars out of 5.
We got there around lunch time, so noonish. It wasn't busy yet, and in plain sight you can see there were plenty of runners and servers. We got seated and immediately greeted by a lovely lady offering us water.  Then our server came, Nick. He seemed loopy. And when I mean loopy, loopy that he was babbling and asking us what time it was "what time is it, is it 3:30?" And my husband and I looked at each other like "it barely noon." What the heck? Then he proceeded to tell us we should have come at 3:30 cause they have daily happy hour and the pricing was way better. I admit they were, but we were already there, it just made us seem like he didn't want us.We ordered beignets for starters, lobster roll, burger and the soufflé. The food took forever to come out.  I mean 20 minutes for 3 pieces
Of beignets. Not sure if our server had put that order in as appetizer or what. I was also very peeved that they didn't clear our dirty and empty dishes and cups right away. The servers and runners were just hanging out at the bar and chit chatting, and passing our table. But never picked it up to clear our table. Mind you we sat on a two top table so all these extra empty plates and dirty dishes easily overtook our table. After introducing himself to us and getting our order we have not seen our server again. The last time was when we were wrapping up lunch, and asked us if there was anything else we needed. I said "more ice please." (I'm 9 months pregnant and there was no air in the restaurant and I was so hot). My extra ice cup never came. . Not sure why there was a lack of service, but something definitely to work on. 

Food review 4/5!
There is no denying the food is amazing. Although the food did take some time to get to the table, it did come out hot and fresh. The food was amazing! Beignet was the amount of sweetness and savory. Omg the burger (very messy eat) had this umami and balance of savory, sweet, and tart which I inhaled. The fries.... duck fat cooked fries... enough said. For dessert the soufflé was delicious. Granted could get it better elsewhere, but still did not disappointed and perfect end of the meal. Keep cooking good food like this, I will come back.
Had a late night Sunday dinner at Andre's last week. The service was phenomenal. My dirty martini was perfect and the steak was just right. Perfect place for a date night. I highly recommend it.

I decided to try a different place. Due to my stomach issues I wanted to get something non spicey. So I ordered a burger and salad. Food was ok but not hot just lukewarm. Pretty expensive due to delivery price. Burger huge so it took all day to eat. Salad was awesome. French fries were quite tasty. So since watching the budget be awhile till I reorder.

Had lunch here yesterday during happy hour and it was one of the best lunches I've had in a while! Andre's burger was perfectly cooked and topped with deliciously sautéed onions and cheese. I will definitely be going back there and trying everything else on the menu!!!

While the rave reviews continue, I remain underwhelmed by my experience here. The service was a little rough, but they had opened only a few weeks prior. The food was only average.

I tried the escargot which were standard, but the baguette that came to the table before hand was wonderful and very nice to soak up the garlic herb butter with. The onion soup au gratin was unremarkable. The salmon entree was bland and could have used some help from a sprinkling of salt. Duck fat fries weren't anything special, but fries are always good. When asked if a shrimp cocktail was possible since they offer a raw bar, it took several trips back and forth to see if they could do so, but in the end they were able to accommodate the request and i appreciated it. It would be helpful to have a raw bar menu so that you could build a seafood platter by mixing and matching. The vegetable terrine, or pate as it might have been called, was one of my favorite things to arrive at the table.

When we sat down, I had asked about a bottle of champagne and recommendations. Little was known about whether or not they had a blanc de blanc or which tended to be more pinot noir heavy. Again, they had only opened for a few weeks, and so I don't blame them for this. I was however, given two different answers which didn't inspire confidence. We also had someone join the table about 30min after we sat down and it was like pulling teeth to get another glass of water, a glass for the champagne, and an order in. The service was a little slow, but to their credit they were very busy that night which is a great sign for business.

I've seen pictures of their beautiful souffles and that alone might be enough to draw me back!

First thing I notice is the décor. Very contemporary, even the mellow music is a match to the atmosphere. The staff is great, attentive and act like they enjoy being there.  Now for the food, I ordered the Trout almonde and it was amazing, brown sugar and lemon? Goes  together well,  I'll definitely be back!

I was extremely excited about this place. French restaurant off the strip?! REALLY? And seeing escargot on the menu, I was SOLD.

I went here with a group of people, and got to try several dishes. 
Escargots- 3.5 stars. 
French Onion Soup- 2 stars.  I'm not sure what cheese they used, but I swear it wasn't Guyere. Maybe mozzarella. It was waaaaay too soft. It lacked the slight bitterness that Guyere adds to the dish, so I was disappointed. 

Seafood platter- 4 stars. Such a small platter for a great price. It's perfect for 1/2 person. Yes, not for 2 is my point. 
My salad with the egg on top sounded great, but I wasn't diggin' it too much, since I didn't finish it. 

My friends loved the baguette they served at the beginning, but I personally wasn't a huge fan. 

I may be back to try several other dishes. It looks like their brunch is a lot more popular.
This restaurant has a good customer service, but the food is overpriced!! It is good quality food but not for the price!

We tried this place for lunch. It was great! We had French onion soup, which is one of my favorites, and this place nailed it! One of my favorites in Vegas. Also had the cheeseburger w/ fries. It all was delicious and hot! Service was also great! I will definitely be back!

You walk up to the outside filled with quotes. Loved it! Then the inside is simple & beautiful. Service was awesome. We had the veggie terraine & a steak delicious! I have tried any dessert but the looked amazing. We also tried the salmon yum!
Happy hour is the best deal going. The burger is great and the french fries are as well.

Great food and service. Bit pricey and limited menu choices but, great drink menu and the food choices they have are super good. Have been here multiple times and recommended. One of better bistros in town
Great breakfast today at Andre's. I had the chicken and waffles. Chicken was cooked to perfection, the waffles could have been just a bit more crispy. I will be back again!

This experience was wonderful from beginning to end. The atmosphere is cozy but a little on the high end side. Alfredo was our server and he made great suggestions and was very attentive and personable. There is a huge wine selection and he suggested the perfect Boudreaux. We had the foie gras which was the best foie gras I've ever had! It was lightly seared and melted in your mouth. The escargot was probably the best I've ever had as well. Next was the prime rib which was massive and super tender. we had a chocolate cake for dessert which was recommended as well. Will definitely be back!
Absolutely one of the best trendy restaurants in vegas....food is amazing...atmosphere is relaxing and service was fantastic...definitely going back

I had a fantastic "power lunch" consisting of French onion soup, ricotta gnocchi and to finish it all, a malted chocolate milkshake. It was simple yet sophisticated. Plated beautifully and great service and conversation. I would highly recommend Andre's for a great lunch or dinner spot.

Family Saturday Brunch at Andre's Bistro. We sat on the patio and brought our bull dog puppy to enjoy the gorgeous spring weather. I shared the croque madame with duck fat fries and eggs benedict with breakfast potatoes with my sister, my niece had the chicken and waffles and more importantly, the little boy my niece is baby sitting is highly lactose intolerant and the bistro staff and chef were able to accommodate his diet by making special non-dairy kids chicken fingers!!! Thank you for taking the extra step in showing great customer service! We will be back Andre's Bistro
Amazing!! I haven't had anything here that wasn't fantastic! Their Andre's burger is delicious. I've had multiple cocktails here that have all been great. Highly recommend!

I've been here 3 times - twice by myself and once on a date night with my husband. The food is great, the service is friendly, and the drinks are boozy. I wish the cocktail prices were a little lower to match the other restaurants  nearby, but it isn't a huge deal. If you want to stop by I highly recommend the french onion soup and potato gnocchi. The last time I visited I brought my dog and we sat on the patio with no problems. Overall it's a great semi-upscale neighborhood restaurant and I'll be back for more gnocchi soon!

I won't cross Andre's off my bookmarks list so that I remember to go back again - and again.  Loved this place!  

We were seated right away, given menus and a paper bag with the best bread I've had since moving to Vegas - 12 or 13 years of drought wiped away with a single bite.  Dense bread, with a crisp crust, just the way I love but can't find here.  See?  - it CAN be done!

Fortified with my glass of good German Riesling, despite the "no booze" warning on the medicine bottle, we ordered a Roasted Golden and Red Beet salad to share.  The kitchen divided it for us, plating each one prettily, and it was soooo good.  It didn't specify greens on the menu, but I was thrilled to see them there.  Just the right amount of dressing was paramount, since I forgot to ask for it on the side.  Wonderful combination of flavors.

My husband ordered Andre's Burger, medium, and it was incredible.  The red onion marmalade was perfect and plentiful, two slices of tomato were actually deep red (an accomplishment in this era of tasteless pink tomatoes), and the bun was brioche-y and lightly toasted, crisp where it needed to be, and soft in the right places.  He had them hold the truffle mayo, but that burger wasn't lacking for anything.  The accompanying basket of fries were enough to feed four.

I went for something different:  Trout Amandine, swimming in a beurre noisette, along with green beans.  I would have loved a larger portion of the green beans, but it was a beautiful dish.  I guess I've become accustomed to spicier food, because I thought it was a tad bland, but I think it was exactly the way it was supposed to be, because I finished every morsel of that sucker, something I never do.  And I was grateful that it wasn't salty at all. 

Our server, Lori (or Laurie?), was friendly and good, and the manager, Cheryl with a C, bade us a warm goodbye.  

I'd love to try their Happy Hour, but having it only from 3:30 to 5:30 makes it unlikely.  So I guess it'll be dinner again next time, and I hope that'll be soon.
This place is amazing. It you haven't tried it, you're losing out. The soufflé was perfect.

Loved the Lobster Thermidor so much we came back the very next week to have it again! It is not on the everyday menu, it is a special, but I guess something they have most of the time.
The Escargot is fabulous, and the Crispy Calamari is another appetizer I would highly recommend.
The Chilled Seafood Platter was tasty, the oysters were delicious, the lobster, however, was a little tough and not one of my favorite parts of the platter.
The Golden Trout Amandine was really really good. The fish was cooked perfectly! It was so light and fluffy and the sauce was a perfect compliment without overwhelming the flavor of the fish.
I am so glad that Andre's Bistro & Bar moved into the area. This will definitely be in our regular rotation for dinner.

First time here, I ordered food to go because my wife was in the hospital and we did not want their food.

Even though the food looked good and everyone was very nice, the problem with food to go is if they over cook your food as in this case, a burger ordered medium rare comes out medium well, it makes the $14 I paid for this burger a waste of $14 dollars.

The fries it came with were good and the garlic mashed was really good.  The only bad part of this meal was the over cooked $14 burger which got thrown away because it tasted horrible.

Will we try this place again, maybe but not for to go food.  Very sad...

What a treat. Skip the chain restaurants for lunch. This is FIRST class Bistro. We came here for the first time and can't say enough about how good the lunch was. Large, super delicious sandwiches with homemade potato chips. We also sampled the desert. OMG, the outstanding walnut chocolate tart is so good we can't wait to go back again. 
Felt like we were back in France or Italy at a 5 star place.
We had to bring part of a sandwich home.  We really are looking forward to trying more of their food and drink. You won't be disappointed.

Great off strip restaurant with Las Vegas history. Nice size ding room with pleasant decor. Wonderful French flare. The fries are a must with any dish.  Have been here several times both lunch and dinner and have enjoyed each visit.
Came with friends for a bday.  Food was amazing,  drinks even better and the owners were so sweet that they sat with us for a photo.  Our new fav spot!

This was our families  4th time eating at Andres bistro,  and, we had another excellent  dinner , we sat down next to the special board , and we both  decided  to try 2 specials ,  the filet, and the risotto special,  both were awesome,  we asked the waiter to make my daughter a grilled cheese sandwich as well and she loved it. I recommend this bistro for a great local night out  dinner experience,  without dealing with the strip, traffic,  and over priced food. Awesome!

I had high expectations for Andre's, especially with many many people telling me how good it was and how it was worth trying. Well little and behold our experience was FUCKING TERRIBLE! I made reservations through OpenTable which was the best part of my experience. It was quick and efficient completely the opposite experience when we arrived at Andre's. I made reservations for 7 plus 1 child at 6:00 PM for Mother's Day dinner. We arrived a few minutes prior to 6:00 and the table was just about ready. We were seated efficiently and this was the best part of our experience. 

Upon being seated, I don't even remember our server introducing himself. We sat down without any menus on the table it took probably 10 minutes before menus were brought to the table. We ordered appetizers as we waited for the rest of our party and our server mentioned he'd drop some bread off at the table as we waited. As the remainder of our party arrived, they had to ask for waters and asked for bread since we had been waiting for 15 minutes already. As we ordered our main courses, TWO of the options I wanted weren't available, I WISH our server had mentioned that certain dishes weren't available anymore. IF our server had told us dishes were unavailable FROM THE START our party could've had our eyes set on items that were available. I'M DISAPPOINTED ANDRE'S! I wanted a lobster roll but you ran out, I wanted the lyonnaise salad with duck confit BUT you ran out as well. It's common courtesy to let your guests know upon seating that certain items were not available anymore. 

Moving forward, once our appetizers arrived, we noticed bread hadn't been dropped at the table yet and two water glasses hadn't been filled either. We asked once more for bread and water and they said they be right back. So as we waited for the water and bread we dived into our apps. By the time we finished our apps bread hadn't been served yet and water glasses weren't filled. I was trying to stay positive about our experience but I have to admit this was FUCKING TERRIBLE! 

Finally receiving bread after 30 minutes and all our apps were finished, the server brought 1 roll to serve 8 people so yet again we had to ask for another roll. We waited another 15 or so minutes for our main course items to come out. As soon as they arrived many more issues arose. All dishes were served EXCEPT the Cobb salad, WHICH admittedly is easier to make than cooking a steak to perfection. ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME?!? Then as one of the steaks were brought out and ORDERED as MEDIUM it was cooked to WELL DONE! And the reason / excuse for the execution was "it was left under the heat lamp too long" YOU'RE KIDDING ME RIGHT?! It's one thing to make up a reason to a guest who doesn't know much about the restaurant industry, but for me the excuse is bullshit. What kind of heat lamps are you using?! 

After approaching the manager of the situation, he said he'd comped some desserts but at this point why would we want anything when everything went wrong. I'm livid about this experience. On a special occasioned day like Mother's Day I would like to think that management would have been better prepared for large parties by staffing appropriately. But unfortunately, we were given pitiful excuses and terrible service.

Delightful Sunday brunch last weekend at Andre's....

As a visitor to the desert annually, we tend to venture off strip to privateer establishments to support local business

Andre's, a bit of hike from the Strip, did not disappoint

Our table of six started with charcuterie and cheese boards and ended with a souffle, creme brulee and a lemon tart

Main brunch items included were lobster roll and fries, chicken and waffles, veggie quiche, cobb salad, chicken caesar salad and spinach omelette

The weakest dish of the bunch was the chicken and waffles imo....the waffle did not hold up well to the gravy slathered on and ended up being soft and mushy

Overall, excellent attention to detail and execution 

We could have easily paid double for similar fare from Bardot Brasserie

If you have wheels, Andre's is well worth the trip

Wasn't really impress - the food has really potential to be good but sims like their chef is not really professional.  The burger was bellow decent -I asked medium and it came well-well done.
The trout was really not fresh and my wife really suffer from bad a stomach ache that night- not going to report this to the health dep anyway.
Drinks are really good and up shelf,bread and batter came very fresh and tasted good-the staff is really friendly .
Probably will be back in 6 month to check it again but for now $120 for 2 people can get us a better place with a better meal.

There have been very limited changes to the decor since Andre's took over the space formerly housing the DW Bistro.  My wife and I started off sharing a Lyonnaise salad that was impressively large and delicious.  Our entrees were less successful with my wife ordering the Scottish salmon and I the moules frites.  The salmon was topped with some roasted bell peppers and included a mundane cauliflower sauce.  My mussels, though farm raised in PEI, had not been cooked long enough leaving several unopened and others on the raw side.  I forgot that our Groupon included 2 glasses of Champagne until I began to settle our bill so we gave those to an adjoining table.

had dinner there for the first time last night since it was formerly DW Bistro.  Nice atmosphere, nice décor, happy hour menu was nice although we didn't order anything from it. We had the oysters, 2 salads and a couple of drinks. It was all good, pretty pricey; but I appreciate the caliber of restaurant in an area off strip. I am so sick of the STRIP!! I would like to try an entrée next time to truly gauge this restaurant, but so far I am happy with this little neighborhood gem.

Went for brunch and were greeted by a friendly server and hostess. We started with the escargots that went well with the fresh French bread. Ordered the steak frites which was beyond small even for a lunch portion. Waiter said it should be at least 5oz. I imagine it was no more than 4oz...4 slices of steak?! Thought the flavor was good, but I've never seen a restaurant serve anything that small, not even a filet. I had the mussels. The flavor was good but menu read "served with tomato, parsley, garlic, etc" and they came out in a saffron cream sauce. When the server insists there are tomatoes in the sauce and can't understand that's not the point - the menu doesn't mention CREAM...the description needs to be rewritten. The food tastes fine but the execution and menu need more attention.

I loved this spot! Not in the location I would expect for such a delightful brunch. Yogurt/Fruit parfaits should never be too incredible because come on, no carbs. But it was so delicious and beautifully presented. Eggs benny was top notch and the potatoes had a hint of crunch with the fluffiest softness inside. And well, bottomless mimosas... need I say more?

Went here for my husband's vacation dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the food and ambiance.  Andre's had a romantic. darkly lit vibe, great for dates and couples.  We started out with a cocktail, can't remember the name but it had ginger syrup.  The flavor reminded me of Chinese medicine tonics, not too bad.  There was plenty of french bread and butter.  Be careful not to fill up on that. The escargots was OK, it was covered in a parsley butter sauce, a little different.  The 'piece de resistance' was the Andre burger, it was moist flavorful, well seasoned and not a hint of dryness.  Definitely one of the best burgers we've ever had.  The duck fat fries were yummy, so were the sweet potato fries.  The fois gras hot dog was fine, though the burger beat it out.  The desserts were pot du creme, a fairly rich chocolate mousse and creme brulee.  Both were excellent.  We were the waitress's suggestion and took a bite from each to mix it up.  

The best thing was the bill was only $43 including tip because of the 3-6pm happy hour special.  Each entree was only $7 the burger, escargots and gourmet dog.  The main entrees were a little more.  The desserts were $4 each.  Must remind myself to try the souffle next time.

Went for brunch on Sunday. Everything we had was great. The mimosa normand was awesome. Had Charcuterie, beignets, french toast, waffles, smoked salmon benedict, and the croque madame. Service was great and the price was reasonable. 
Cant wait to go back! So happy to have them as neighbors!
My husband I went in for dinner and were very impressed. A unique menu without being intimidating and everything we ordered was delicious. I really want to go back and try the brunch.

First time here and was impressed. Started with the escargot and French onion soup.  They have gluten free bread as well, was really tasty, like rye bread.  Escargot was done in a garlic butter sauce, and was very good. Onion soup was very good and very hot.  I had the daily special beef Bourgogne with mashed potato while my wife had the trout almandine.  Beef was very tasty and melt in mouth tender. The trout was done perfectly, green beans were crisp and yummy and both out mashed potatoes were good.  For dessert my wife had the lemon tart and loved it, I had the seasonal sorbet and berries.  The sorbet was pineapple and I found it to be too tart for me.  I was expecting sweeter but got a really sour sorbet.  I'm not a sour person, so I didn't really like it.  Berries were good!  Definitely be back.
Wonderful staff, food and atmosphere.  Great finding a spot with this kind of quality and off the strip!

This is where the old DW bistro used to be and the setting is the same great setting for lunch or dinner. The food is above average. If you have a business lunch or evening out this is a good choice! Staff was A+ friendly as well.

Overall: very nice place to dine.  The service was outstanding, that locks it at 5 stars.  The food was good; escargot was very tasty (but please provide an escargot fork, it was difficult wrangling the snails with a dinner fork), onion soup and salad were excellent, as was the Scottish salmon.  The lobster roll was good, but a bit skimpy for the price.  Be aware that the lunch menu is quite limited, but tasty.

Came here a week after their opening day with our friends who had friends that worked/works here.  Impeccable hospitality?  I would say yes, but then they're missing other things.  They got the clearing your plates and refill your water and asking if you want another glass.  That's about it.  They didn't bring you an empty bowl for your mussel shells if you do order that dish. 
 They didn't check to see or ask if you're done with your oysters and the escargots...we still had 2 left.  Food is ok, nothing I'm craving for since I ate there. 

The other half of our table drank a lot... and ordered a bunch of things which I couldn't eat because of my food allergy.  So for me and my husband...paying $150-200 per couple is quiet a lot especially for ok food and service and off strip.   I rather go to the Rhino and spend that on Rhino platter, grill cheese, and shots. 

We'll have to give this place another try for lunch and/or happy hour and that it's been months since they've opened.  It seems to be where this place is gets positive reviews from and mostly friends of the staff who are leaving superb reviews.

Very tasty dinner.   We used to go to the original location Downtown, and have missed its vintage charm.   This new location is cozy albeit in a strip mall, but the food is still a excellent quality.  I had the fois gras app and the lobster thermador, delish!   Service was excellent, a more casual version of the original, which is just fine for a Friday night.

Services: 2 stars
Food: 3.5 stars 
Atmosphere:4 stars 

I have been here quite a few times for both brunch and dinner. I enjoy some of the items a lot but I feel like they need to work on consistency here. The services here I received majority of the time also turned me off. 

Services: on my recent visit, this old waiter with the accent made me not wanting to come back. He had my table before the recent visit as well. I was not a fan of him because he's not polite and borderline rude. On our entire visit, he only came to check on us once at the beginning and handed us the check. I had to get another server to take our order. And the other server was the one who came back and refilled the water. He explained to me that the older gentleman was "busy". He passed by our table several times. He never once acknowledged us. What was the worst was when he handed us the bill, he didn't say anything AT All! Not a thank you, not a sorry that I wasn't able to take care of you guys earlier. Just dead silence. He needs to be trained how to be a server. His behavior was absolutely not acceptable. I appreciate the other younger server who took care of us though. 

Food: I like the food here for the most part. However, they are not consistent. 

Things I have tried: 

1. French Onion Soup (3/5): I loved their French onion soup the first time I've had it and I recommended it to my friends who lover this dish. However, like other yelper mentioned, where's all the cheese? For some reason, the cheese wasn't there the second time I had it and it was disappointing. 

2. Lyonnaise Salad (5/5): I usually add the duck with my salad. It is delicious with the perfectly poached egg. They can also split into two for you. You can add additional egg for another person. 

3. Escargot (4/5): the sauce is yummy with their baguette. 

4. Seared Foie Gras (4/5): I've only had it once. It was good but not the best I've had.  

5. Moules Frites (2/5): it was lacked of flavors and a boring dish. 

6. Flat iron steak (2/5): I ordered medium rare and it came out medium well?! Did not enjoy my steak at all. Duck Fat fries was still good then. 

7. Andres burger (5/5): the burger is really good! I suggest your share the burger and get a salad with someone else. The flavor was excellent. However, it's quite greasy to eat the whole burger if you don't have a big appetite. 

8. Chicken and waffles (2/5): what happened to the whole waffle! We only got half of the waffles. The pictures from other yelper came with the whole waffles (4pc). We only got 2 pieces. Since we were not that hungry, we didn't ask the server. Even the two pieces were super tiny. I wouldn't order it again. Better flavored chicken and waffles elsewhere. 

9. Duck Fat Fries (3/5): I used to love it but on my recent visits, the flavor of duck fat was not there. 

10. Soufflé (5/5): Love the grand mariner soufflé here. One of the best in town. 

11. Quiche Lorraine (4/5): I enjoyed the quiche. But the potato on the side was meh. 

Their kitchen needs to be more organized too. One time I took my friend there to celebrate her engagement. We basically finished my dish before they were able to serve hers. She ended up getting it togo. In all, there's definitely recommended dishes from this place, however, if the consistency and quality of the services can't be provided. I foresee this place will have the same fate as the one in Monte Carlo and Alize.

Our family reserved the private dining area this past Sunday to celebrate my daughters 1st birthday. The room was decorated so beautifully. For 50 it was cozy which was perfect for us. We have been there several times for brunch so we knew the food would be delicious. Which of course it was. Many compliments on the lobster roll and salmon. The most amazing experience of the night was the service that was provided. Jana who coordinated everything for us was so thorough and kind. Once we got there, Lori was the coordinator who assisted us. She went above and beyond to accommodate our every request and every need. We couldn't thank her enough to making this celebration a memorable night. Additionally the pastry chef designed a beautiful 3-tier cake for us. We can't stop looking at the pictures. The entire night was a celebration that exceeded our expectations. Thank you!

WOW!  My husband and I were looking for a great French restaurant and we found it at Andre's!
Started with the foie gras - 2 orders since my husband doesn't like to share :)...
Our servings were generous and perfectly prepared.  Delicate and delicious...I savored every bite.
Husband had the French onion soup to start and we shared the artisan sausage plate.  The chef is creating magic in every dish, we look forward to making this restaurant a regular on our list of go-to dining options!
Service from Nate and Kenny was spot on, attentive, present when needed and knowledgeable.
Thank you for satisfying our French food cravings...we loved every bite!

My fav spot for a good steak and a craft cocktail. The wine list is delicious. I'm a big fan of patios and dog friendly places. Its a good balance. I can park my bicycle after a nice ride with my pup and enjoy a super fancy meal. Great sangria.

Had a fantastic brunch here over the weekend. I ordered the Croque Madam w/ the salad and bottomless Rose.  So delicious! And the baguette they bring is warm and so tasty. Definitely want to come back to try dinner.  Super cute location as well and nice patio.

Inattentive service. Inspite of Ample staffing. No offer to refill water. Beignets served without cutlery. Overall mediocre food at $$$ prices. 
No bowl provided for mussel shells.
Came at lunch Sunday.
Child's menu found on colouring sheet but? waiter made no mention of it.

Been here twice, still not feeling it. I appreciate the finer approach to the neighborhood bistro, but the arrogance can be left out. The food was extremely heavy, rich more like it... duck fat galore. Unknowledgeable when it came to the cheese and charcuterie boards, seafood platter wasn't explained when dropped either, rather annoying. Bummer, I was hoping to enjoy this place.

We don't normally celebrate Valentines Day but I've been wanting to try the newly opened Andre's so hubby surprised me by making reservations. 

We were seated right away even though we got there 15 minutes early, a plus in my book. The place is minimally decorated which gives off a more sophisticated look. Even though the tables are spaced closer than I would've wanted, it didn't deter my excitement in finally trying this place. 

Along with the regular menu, a prix fixe menu was offered for the night. I perused what it had to offer and since I'm not really a big fan of oysters we decided on doing ala carte instead. 

We started with the bread. Conscious enough not to fill up on it, and making sure we had room for dessert because after all that was the main reason I wanted to try Andre's lol. We were undecided if appetizers should be ordered but ultimately gave in. Calamari was lightly crisp and served with a sweet Thai Chili sauce. For our entrees Hubby opted for the 10 oz flat iron steak with bearnaise sauce as recommended by our server, with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. Honestly that sauce was not even necessary. That steak was perfection! Tender and flavorful, mouthwatering. I had my eyes set on the Roasted Chicken breast with mushrooms, bacon, pearl onions and fingerling potatoes. Moist with crispy skin, deliciousness in every bite. 

Make sure you let your server know ahead of time if you're planning to get soufflé for dessert, it takes about 25 minutes to make it. Lemme tell you, it's worth waiting for and worth all the calories! It was lusciously gratifying. 

I can't wait to return and try their brunch options. Also looking forward to trying the escargot and maybe the frog legs?!?! Best part is you get all this at a fraction of the strip prices. Délicieux, bon appétit!

Service was phenomenal, everyone from the hostess, the bartender, Dani/Danny the server, the bussers, and anyone else who helped us were so incredibly nice and genuine. 

I really liked the small atmosphere.. It's got two rooms but the one that was attached to the bar area was awesome.. It had good every ave everyone was having a great time. Plus it was close to the kitchen so food came out quickly!! 

The drinks were good!! Their happy hour is 3-6pm I believe, and it's $2 off drinks!! I had the lamb shank with orzo pasta, served in a savory broth. My friend had the bouillabaisse which was cooked very well and had a great presentation!! 

The frog legs were okay.. But maybe I just had very high expectations since it was my first time!!

My friend decided to have her birthday brunch here over the weekend. And we were all very satisfied. 

This place has a lot of options. Which is great. But, I had to look at the pics to decide on what to get. What is good:

Lobster Roll
French Toast
Beignets 

Do note: This place is a little pricier. Their bottomless mimosas are $24. That's pretty pricey for the other brunch places. And they really don't put a ton of champagne in it. That was probably my only complaint. 

Other than that, the service was good and they were pretty quick. 

Yummy place, and will definitely be back!

Go for brunch! Went a few weeks ago and it was bomb. Thought $10 for 5 pastries was a little steep but it was worth it - loved the plain croissant and almond pastry. I got the eggs Benedict and it was way better than average because of the cut and flavor of the ham - so tasty. Also the coffee was good (way better than typical diner coffee) and all the cups, plates, settings, etc. are very colorful and cute.

Service pretty good, atmosphere was nice and modern.
First time we came here the experience was excellent. French onion soup was one of the best i've had in a long time and they had a really good Croque monsieur. 
Second time around the soup didn't hold up to my initial expectations, and as well they no longer offered my Croque monsieur sandwich. We had the mussels and fries - the sauce was so bland we asked if they could do something about it. I almost never do this. I felt a little embarrassed to call out the chef- no cook ever wants to be told their food is bland. They did attempt to fix it and give the sauce more flavor and body but it was doomed from the beginning. 
Overall decent French food, but a little on the pricey side for the food quality and flavors.
3.5 stars.

Went to happy hour with my parents and we really enjoyed everything we had. We started with frog legs and escargot, then moved onto the charcuterie and the cheese boards.  The foie gras mouse was sublime The onion soup was delicious as well as the burgers.

Impressed from the moment Mark Purdy and Joe Marsco first opened the doors to Andre's Bistro & Bar, the transition from a fine-dining stalwart inside the Monte Carlo to a casual French bistro in the former DW Bistro space originally marred only by music that was both too loud and out of place, a recent return for brunch with out of town guests has shown the restaurant to have only gotten better in the intervening months, a shake-up at Alize necessitating a split of Mark's time doing nothing to diminish the quality of a kitchen under the guidance of Marty Red DeLeon Lopez.

Now approaching the four-month mark, early struggles to understand a new market ironing themselves out with time, Spring sees Andre's welcoming guests for both Lunch and Dinner on weekdays plus weekends at Brunch, a party of 4 met by Mr. Marsco soon after entering with seating quickly offered along a banquette suitable for six, the extra space needed as the decision was made to trust the kitchen carte blanche.

Originally decided upon based on two Southerners' desire for French food, their visits to both Bouchon and Bardot favorable on previous trips to Sin City, it was with pleasantries exchanged and Coffee from Las Vegas' own Vesta Roasters soon flowing that Chef Marty approached the tableside telling the group menus would not be necessary, "I hope your brought an appetite" never as ominous as it seems when it promises twenty different dishes coursed out over a total of just under two hours and twenty minutes.

Told that Chefs Rochat and Purdy were frequently in and out, the recent hiring of Joshua Bianchi at the top of the Palms likely to see Purdy back on a more consistent basis soon, brunch at Andre's once again began with two treats from Chef Tammy Alana, the Beignets dusted in Powdered Sugar still every bit on par with the best of NOLA while the Pastry Basket yielded a far more crunchy Croissant than last time, the Almond version more like the Danish terms of consistency while the Peaches and Cream replicating sunny-side Eggs remains as fun as it is delicious.

Both starting and ending with Chef Alana's sweets, the bulk of the meal a steady flow of Rochat classics and several brunch favorites, round two was comprised of two rashers of sweet and smoky Bacon as well as the Escargots de Bourgongne plus Andre's ever impressive collection of housemade Pates and imported Meats and Cheese, the Bacon-wrapped Pate as chunky and funky as many served in France while the Bermuda Triangle, Cherry Moustarda and Rillettes all went well with a Warm Baguette, still one of the Las Vegas' most impressive complimentary Bread services.

Attempting to take it easy on the Carbs, though the quality Butter and housemade Jams made such a thing more challenging than usual, a course most easily described as "Eggs" arrived next, both Andre's Classic Benedict and one with Smoked Salmon pitch-perfect beneath thick Hollandaise and soft-poached Yolks while the Brioche at the base of a Croque Madame was thinner than in the past and thus more typical to that served in France, a good thing for those who value authenticity as well as folks who which to save more room for the generous helping of buttery Breakfast Potatoes or Fries cooked crisp in Duck Fat.

Continuing to put its name into the hat for Sin City's best Chicken & Waffles, the juxtaposition of soft Cornbread and crunchy Buttermilk Batter plus Country Gravy admittedly more Southern USA than South of France, those looking for something a bit less heavy would be well advised to check out Andre's Maine Lobster Roll served on toasted Bread with just a touch of Mayonnaise, the duo of Quiches also both well made with good Custard and a clean-edged Crust, the Vegetarian version a bit more balanced as the combination of Bacon and aged Comte in the Lorraine came across a little more salty than some might want.

Getting full at this point, though happy to set aside any plans for weekend productivity in exchange for a truly grand finale followed by a parade of Desserts, it was alongside an Herb-Butter soaked Steak cooked Medium-Rare that two slices of Foie Gras and Nutella Brioche were served topped in Strawberries and Sauternes Glaze, the carnivorous more than happy to over-indulge while those fond of pastry thankfully held back a little bit, the Float, Sundae and Crème Brulee all quite good but difficult to gush over while the rich Pot de Crème, tangy Lemon Tart and elegant Walnut Pie with Chocolate and Caramel were all beyond reproach...and at $8 each a veritable steal for Desserts of such quality.

*****Offering a menu at Brunch that can go toe-to-toe with names like Thomas Keller or Michael Mina, the prices generally discounted by at least 25% for comparable plates, Andre's Bistro & Bar has achieved in short-order what many restaurants strive a lifetime for in a city known for rushed openings and fast shutters, a destination spot in the neighborhood that is as impressive to tourists as it is a gift to locals.

Sometimes you want a really good meal, without having to travel to the Strip. Thank goodness for off-Strip restaurants like Andre's Bistro & Bar.
