I came here with my husband for a brunch date. The setting was very intimate. We had the option of dining al fresco style or inside. Although the weather was perfect, we asked for a table towards the back of the restaurant for more privacy.

Andre's Bistro has a wonderful staff that caters to a sophisticated local crowd. 

The restaurant had New Orleans style jazz piped in, so I though it was only fitting to order the beignets. It made me feel as though I'd been transported to the Big Easy. Our server suggested the spinach omelette, which had tomatoes, goat cheese, spinach and mushrooms, plus breakfast potatoes. My husband opted for the salmon burger with sweet potato fries. Both entrees had a ton of flavor!!For dessert, we shared the Saturday Sundae and the chocolate soufflé. The soufflé took about 20 minutes, but was totally worth it. The sundae was made with homemade vanilla ice cream, brownies, hot fudge, caramel sauce and hazelnuts. It sort of reminded me of a praline sundae. Overall, this was the perfect meal!

Great vibe/decor, eclectic menu and a great bartender (Cameron).  

Very cool, chill, casual but upscale vibe in the establishment.  The menu is always being revised so don't expect some of the items on yelp to be available. Still, the menu won't disappoint.  

We weren't super hungry so I had escargot with duck fat fries and my wife had the lobster role with sweet potato fries.  Everything was very good. The duck fat fries were bomb!   

What made the night for us was the bartender, Cameron.  We will be back to hang with him again and enjoy his libations.

Went last Saturday for a spur of the moment brunch.  The service was very good, you could tell he came from fine dining. Bloody Mary was not my favorite, and over priced in a small glass, I would prefer a better recipe.  We had the Vegetable Quiche - awesome  - light fluffy  very good!  and the Brioche French Toast, also a hit!  We were first in as they opened so everyone was on point. The server offered the Beignets as a complimentary sample from the chef - they were super!  I will be calling to order a dozen for pick up!  It is not two $$  three for sure, but worth it.    I would go back!

I was at the bar today around 4:15 pm i had ordered escargot and a lamb burger medium,i got the escargot after chewing on the second one i found cjopped shells in one of my escargot,let the bartender who was nice enough to take it back and apologized and got me a new order.i finished my new order and started dipping my bread in the garlic sauce that was left then i found a piece of plastic,i got really disappointed and mad.at tgat time my burger has arrived and i let my bartender know.remember i gave this kithen a second chance to correct the order especially that am a server as well so i am aware of things.i didnt finish my burger cause it was a little rare for me and plus i was disgusted with what hapoened throughout the meal.the bartender was nice and fruendly and of course he took the escargot of my check.i was craving that place for a long time but i dont think i got the best first  impression.too bad cause the menu looks decent.

Did someone say, brunch?  Who doesn't love Rose' all day on Saturday and Sunday's.(Well maybe from open until 3ish)  

They did a nice job renovating the former DW Bistro while still maintaining some of the charm. We love sitting at the bar when Tim's working, as he is so attentive and personable. The bar stools feel like a "pillowy-cushion" and you can charge your phone if you have a USB cord! Awesome when your phone is always on the dead side!

If a burger is your poison, this is the place to chow down on one. The bun paired with sautéed onions and butter lettuce melts in your mouth. If a salad is your thing, stop at the cobb.  The winner here for appetizer's is the escargot. The garlicky, herbal mixture was nothing short of amazing.  You'll want to order extra French bread to sop up the extra sauce because they give you plenty.  

The downside is, they took the croissants off the menu for whatever reason known to man.  We hope they have an epiphany and put them back on.  Bon' Apetit, my sweets.

I do like this place the food is good but a little overpriced. I was there last weekend and they happened to have a shift change and so we sat there for 20 minutes trying to flag down wait staff. Their servers are always so very nice but when they get busy they really need to up their servers.

This is our favorite neighborhood spot.  They really have carved out the perfect definition of what I think of when I want some place nice, yet comfortable for a meal and wine that is a short drive from my house.
The service is on point; we visit about 1-2 times a month or so and everyone is so friendly.  Everything on the menu is amazing and the wine selection is nice.  Their happy hour is a great deal, with a nice variety of discounted items from all over the menu included and $2 off wine by the glass. Plus their happy hour runs 7 days a week.

Some of our favorite things on the menu include the lyonnaise salad with the duck confit, the seafood platter, lamb burger, coq au vin, seared foie gras.

They have added more tvs, which is nice because we were able to watch the rest of the Golden Knights game the other evening.

The first time I came here, it was ironically last year during restaurant week. I remember that they did not know about it initially until they asked someone in the kitchen and then brought the menus out. They were not well organized but they made up for it with good food. They were new at current location. That is why I gave them five stars at that time.
Tonight, I was let down. To begin with, there were five people in my party and I specifically put on my open table reservation that it is for a birthday and the name of the person. I even called the restaurant personally one hour before and they confirmed that they had the information that this was for someone's birthday. 
We get there on time and we are sat at a regular table. We are given regular menus. I see that the waiter is holding smaller menus, which did turn out to be restaurant week menus, but he did not give us those until I asked for them. This is the second year, during restaurant week, where they did not offer the restaurant week menu. Then, to make things worse, our waiter is absolutely clueless! First he tells us that he believes that a filet mignon is on the restaurant week menu that can replace the flat iron steak and then he tells me that there is a dorade type of fish on the menu. Neither is right. We order our food and the food is pretty good. We get to dessert, and nothing! No candle (not important), no decoration (not important), no happy birthday (important). Her dessert was as plain as ours. 
Several times we had to signal the waiter to come over to fill water glasses as they were empty for quite a while. I also had to signal someone for the check. What's crazy is that the restaurant was not full... In fact it was less than half full!
The food at this restaurant is delicious, but the service has a great deal left to be desired. I hope a manager reads this and takes this seriously because I have come to this restaurant over eight times in the last year and usually the service is OK or below par, and it has never been outstanding. I chose to come here instead of going to an incredible restaurant on the strip for convenience because we only live five minutes from this restaurant. I was really let down tonight and my friend's birthday was non existent! This restaurant needs to be careful because it may have great food but it needs to keep up good service. Once again, really let down tonight.

Great spot for brunch. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place a couple of months ago when they first opened. We loved the atmosphere inside. Everything is very modern and fresh. Their cocktails are on point, I remember being very pleasantly surprised. The portions are perfect too. I hate when I go out for breakfast and the portions are huge! I always take it home but then never end up eating it. But these were perfect and very delicious. We have to try it for dinner at some point but I highly recommend brunch.

Went here with a large group so we were able to try many different menu items. Everything was fabulous with great presentation. My favorites were the risotto, French onion soup and creme brulee. Never had the chance to make it to Andre's on the strip so I am glad we have this spot now to frequent. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. Will definitely be back!

Only came here for Happy Hour however I am looking to come here for both Brunch/Lunch (if I can wake up early enough) and Dinner.

We ordered:

Afternoon Joe - basically a bourbon spiked coffee that was strong as hell.

Frog Legs Provencal - first time eating frog legs...everyone always said it tastes like chicken but to me its more like gator...a mix of chicken and fish...not the biggest fan of frog legs but the sauce was excellent with the bread

Andre's Burger - for the price of $7 you get an amazing good quality burger with fries...a bigger steal then the piggies that tried to steal jewelry from the Bellagio.

French Onion Soup - Not the best but it sure was one of the cleanest broth for a French Onion Soup I had...if that makes sense...

Lamb Burger - didn't try it..not a fan of lamb however my girl that ordered it said it was juicy but didn't quite like the taste...

Overall they have a very solid menu regardless of the time of day and with established quality to the name and for the price point you know that you are getting a excellent meal at an affordable price.

Andre's is the place to be to celebrate your birthday with a large group!

They are very attentive to reservations and following up to the moment you walk in- they welcome you with a warm welcome!

It was perfect start to celebrating the evening. I started with a Cheese Cheese and Charcuterie Board Dinner & Pinot Grigio! So amazing, the only wish we had was crackers instead of bread. Then, we moved on to Escargots de Bourgogne for a different pace of taste which was melting into your mouth right when you take your first bite. After, my friends decided to surprise me with the One of Each dessert platter. I blew my candles with Saturday Sundae which was the hardest piece to share since it was so decadent and delicious I didn't want the taste to end!

My server Christian was a great server and as well as the others who helped with my party of 10! Thanks again Andre's! Will for sure be coming back and recommending.

What a wonderfully delightful gem to find in the southwest part of town. When looking for what another diner called "fasual" or fancy casual French/American fusion dining, look no further than André. Celebrity chef and AAA 4 Diamond honored André Rochat has taken over the old DW space and opened the newest French restaurant in SW Las Vegas. The ambiance is upscale but casual and very chic. I love everything about this place from the dim pendant lights to the rooster bottles on the shelves to the real silver tea kettles. This place knows how to serve up delicious French fare and you don't have to break the bank enjoying it! We enjoyed the escargot for our starter.  The garlic herb butter was absolutely to die for and is perfect for dipping your crusty and warm baguette. For our entrees we had the Braised Lamb Shank and Orzo and Burger with Truffle mayonnaise.  Both were delicious but the lamb shank was fall of the bone goodness! For Dessert was the delicious Creme Brullee topped with fresh fruit and caramelized sugar. Everything was on point. I have found my favorite new restaurant in town!!

We were big fans of Andre Rochat's namesake restaurant at the Monte Carlo, so it was bittersweet when we heard of its closing. But the opening of Andre's Bistro & Bar in the far southwest corner of the valley is much more than a consolation prize - it's pure Parisian bistro fare in a contemporary setting, with neighborhood prices. It blew our minds how inexpensive the entire brunch menu was, with nearly everything under $20 and most entrees in the $10-12 range.

We started with an order of three beignets, served hot and pillowy with a dusting of powdered sugar. With a crusty exterior and an almost crueller-like interior, they were a perfect way to start the meal.

We then moved on to the pastry basket, which included a croissant, chocolate croissant, almond danish, raspberry (?) danish, and something called "Mr. Sunny Side," which was a pastry with custard and apricots arranged to look like an egg.

Choosing a main was a difficult decision (thankfully the prices and location mean we'll be back early and often!) but I went with the smoked sausage, gruyère, and caramelized onion omelet, and it was perfect, all of the elements complimenting one another in one big eggy umami bomb. I did swap out my breakfast potatoes for frites (I mean, it's a bistro) and they were exactly what I was hoping for, crisp and flavorful.

Other entrées ordered at the table included a sausage platter, served with a warm potato salad, and a smoked salmon benedict. I didn't try either of them but my dining companions looked pleased with their orders.

Amid a flurry of great new restaurant openings in the Southwest, Andre's Bistro and Bar is poised to become a neighborhood institution.

Love love love this place!  I always order a flat water served on a wine glass, the lyonnaise salad with the Lardons extra crispy, and the hamburger with extra crispy duck fries.  My husband always gets the modules frites which are delicious! Can not wait to try their brunch!

Had to change review unfortunately the last 3 times we have gone each time it has been a different chef and the food is terrible.
Delicious & perfect lunch spot!! Great quality food & service. Nice decor & vibes. The power express lunch is a great deal!!

My husband and I can't WAIT to come back to Andre's Bistro.  I first read about Andre's when we got the news Alize was closing. We loved the food at Alize but the ambiance was a bit too formal for everyday ventures.  Andre was mentioned in the article and the bistro sounded like a dream come true. Contemporary french in our neighborhood? We knew we had to try!

We were not disappointed.  Cute, trendy ambiance. Intimate but casual at the same time. GREAT drinks (french 75s served in coupes are our faaaave), and food was reasonably priced. We had the oysters, french onion soup, lobster roll, and some sausage dish (my husband).  We wanted a quick-ish dinner and they got us out of there in an hour without a rush! We can't wait to come back and try more dishes!

For quite some time, my gut had been starving for a nearby neighborhood French dinner spot....and now that ludicrously; shallow-assed prayer has been answered!  Andre's move from Monte Carlo to southwest Vegas may be a loss for tourists, but a huge win for locals.    I loved the fasual (fancy/casual) setting as well.  

Finding it difficult to commit to any appetizer, since they all looked so damn good, we chose 3 (Sorry, escargot.  Next time!).  The Lyonnaise Salad was a great start.  Busting the poached egg all over the frisee and smoked lardons provided us with our own little private #yolkporn show.  Savoring those final fork stabs of cured pork fat had me yearning for another order as soon we met the face of the plate.  

Seared Foie Gras: Baybeee, this is what I came for!  So enamored was I with this dish at the Strip location; this was an absolute must-order.   $10 less and a bit smaller in portion still delivered the mouth orgasm I sought.  The apple strudel accompaniment was new to me and took things up a notch (my belt included).

Not accounting for how fantastic the two complimentary warm baguettes with butter would be, there were concerns about not making the finish line, which was the Grand Marnier soufflé that had to pre-ordered, so we split the special of the night.  Their Coq Au Vin was rich and satisfying; filled with chicken, mushrooms, and lardons (yes, more!), it was a wonderful segue to dessert.  

I am so down for repeat visits.  Whether it's lunch, weekend brunch, frog legs at happy hour or just a couple of cocktails.  Can't wait!

Andre's is the hidden gem on the west side!  Great ambiance, great service and there is always something in the menu I can really enjoy.  The Golden Trout Amadine dish is one of the best I've had.  The Seared Foie Gras is to die for!  The Braised Lamb very satisfying and the Bouillabaisse on Friday's is always great.  Best of all, is the Rib Eye Steak, which IMHO is a better deal than Fleming's any day.

The Andre's burger is the best burger that I've tasted in quite some time! It came with duck fat fries! Delicious! Great and fast service, decent beer and wine list. I highly recommend this place and I will be returning.

Went in for their Happy Hour after spending a day hiking at Red Rock Canyon. We were a bit dusty from the hike, but the restaurant didn't seem to mind. We had the house made sausages, Andre's burger (they asked how we wanted it, so we went with rare) and the pot de creme for dessert. And plenty of drinks. Perfect way to end the day with a semi-causal romantic dinner!

I found this spot when I was out running errands at lunch time the other day. I sat  at the bar had the best French onion soup ever and a glass bottle coke. The bartender was friendly and made me feel at home. 

Followed up by the best cappuccino! 

My hubby and I went again today and shared a burger for happy hour and we believe it was Andre that waited on us and he treated us like royalty even though we only spent $18.

I went out to this neighborhood place on a recommendation and was expecting a great meal - thinking I probably should have hit anyplace on the strip and just overpaid or hit the In N Out.  I was there on a Thursday night and it wasn't particularly busy, but the servers seemed ill-prepared and overwhelmed (reminded me of monkeys running around the cage at the zoo).  I was never really sure who my server was as my order was taken by the hostess (who seemed to be the one bright spot on the staff).  I ordered a ribeye and spinach and a glass of wine.  When my steak came it was not even warm (I ordered it Med rare) so I sent it back.  It came back to me in about 5 minutes and it really wasn't any warmer so they offered to make me a new one and the chef was bringing it out himself.  This one was warm, but it was the oddest looking ribeye that I have ever seen - it had a really odd shape and looked like someone took a bite out of the center.  However, the steak had very little, if any, seasoning and was the toughest ribeye I have ever had - tougher than a strip steak and it really didn't taste very good.  Maybe order the next grade up of steak from Sysco or at the local grocery store where this meat must have come from (sarcasm).  I should mention that the spinach was good - very simple, but good.  They did end up comping my steak (charging me just for the wine), but I would have rather had a good steak.  I was a bit surprised that I never heard from or saw a manager and I did send them an email when I got back home detailing my experience and never heard back.   One of the most disappointing meals and overall experiences that I have had at a restaurant in quite a while.

I researched the best burger in LV and Andre's came up.  After driving about 25 minutes from the Strip I landed at Andre's.  I was blown away by the food. I didn't even order the burger (which comes with caramelized onion and a red marmalade jam, cheese and bacon) but instead ordered the Lyonnaise salad with Lardons (think thick cuts of porky belly) and a poached egg with warm sherry vinaigrette.  After one bite I was in heaven.  It was an EXPLOSION of favors on my pallet.  Did I forget to mention that I added duck confit to the salad?  It was amazing,  absolutely incredible.  Get there early on a Friday afternoon for happy hour and wonderful service provided by Bailey (the waitress with attentive service and a warm smile).    The chef is French;  he  knows French cooking--from French onion soup to chocolate soufflés.  This  ain't his first rodeo ya'll.  He's got a restaurant on "The Strip"  too.  Give this place a try.  You won't regret it.

I thought I was going to DW Bistro but ended up at a new to me restaurant lunching on fine French dining. Escargot magnificent Trout Almondine  delightful great French wine list #yum. Cameron alias Pepe our waiter is fabulous!

Review based on lunch and two dinners. You won't be disappointed with the tasty lobster roll for lunch. Nice soft bread and they don't skimp on the lobster.  For dinner had the delicious beet salad and mushroom risotto which was being eyed jealously by my tablemates. It was as good as it looked. Haven't tried anything sub-par at Andrea yet. Hope they stick around.

First time at this fun little bistro! One of my very good friends from San Diego was visiting and we decided to do brunch. Well, I knew just the place thanks to Yelp!

Easy to find and close to home. We were greeted warmly and seated promptly when we arrived. The hostess did ask us if we had a reservation and I could see why. The place was almost full and I was glad there was just two of us. Our server Bailey was really what made our experience a 5 Star! She was full of personality and then I found out she hails from Michigan which is where my hubby is from, so we hit it off. She was helpful with our selections. I would love to have her again as my server next time I eat here.

It happened to be National Waffle Day yesterday for those that were unaware, but I just wasn't in the Waffle mood. There were some awesome looking Waffle dishes listed on the menu to try though.

I selected the Quiche Lorraine and my friend decided on the Lobster roll sandwich. Our food arrived timely and everything was really tasty. The Lobster roll did not lack Lobster and we shared both plates so we had a chance to enjoy both entrees. The Quiche was hot and cooked just right with a spicy finish. I had a yummy mimosa and my friend had a pricey glass of Chardonnay which she really enjoyed. We decided to close out the meal with an order of beignets. Oh my! Just so melt in the mouthy were these lil gems! Thank goodness there were only three as we could have ate more.

We sat inside since there was no room outside so I would recommend making a reservation if you really want to sit outside. The great weather heading our way is a good reason to sit outside. The interior is beautifully decorated with a mixture of industrial, modern and old world. It has a very charming feel and the space is not too big. The bar area is small but cozy. I could easily see myself dropping by for a little happy hour.

Honestly, I can't wait to return for dinner!

For the price of the food I was expecting a spectacular meal. Froie Gras was extremely disappointing and looked as if a 10 year old put the dish together $28. Gnocchi was okay but I wasn't wowed. Gnocchi was in one corner, peas in one and cheese on another. Service was good I just wish the food was properly executed. A glass of Sauternes, a glass of Ro?e Champagne and 2 course meal plus tip $90. Hopefully Andre's will step it up their food game.
The best French onion soup in Vegas!  Loved every dish I ordered .Boulabase and salmon were outstanding and when I got chocolate souffle, I knew I am in love with this place.

MGM's loss is our gain. The valley will now get to experience the total culinary experience that is Andres.

Andre's Bistro is an amazing space with a great vibe. The food and service are out of this world.

I went here today with 2 friends and our children. 

Service - 1 star
It took almost 30 minutes before we were able to order and our food didn't arrive until over an hour after we arrived. No one stopped to see how we were doing. Even though we did ask if the kids foot could come out early, and were told it would, we got all of our food at the same time and at this point the kids were starving

Beignets - 5 stars
These were delicious. Hot, sweet and amazing.  If everything else hadn't t been so horrible I would be back for these. 

Kids mac and cheese - 1 star for kids, 3 stars for an adult
This is not a kids mac and cheese.  It may be on the kids menu but it's not for kids.  Bread crumbs on top and made with a strong flavored cheese.  The cheese to noodle ratio was also way off with the noodles swimming in cheese and the noodles were way over cooked to mush. Neither of the kids that ordered it ate it which was lucky for me (see below). 

Kids chicken fingers - 2 stars for kids, 4 for adults
Also and adult dish hiding on the kids menu.  My son loved the fries. The chicken fingers had some sort of spice in the breading.  I thought they were delicious but none of the kids would eat them. Also, this plate came out scalding hot. The waiter carried it out with a napkin and warned us how hot the plate was.  When I pointed out it was for a one year old and we would like a cool plate the set it down anyway and said it wasn't that hot. When I touched it I almost burned myself.  Considering toddlers reach out and grab everything I'm lucky we didn't walk away with blisters.  Despite the temperature of the plate, the food was ice cold. Lucky for me, my some likes cold food so he still ate the fries. 

Brioche French Toast - 1 star
I ate one bite of the French toast which was both greasy and cold.  I'm not sure how you make French toast greasy.  The waiter asked how the food was after I had the first bite and I mentioned it was cold. He took it back and after everyone else was half done with their meals, he brought back the same plate which was now lukewarm and rubbery.  It had clearly been stuck in a microwave.  

Ceaser salads - 1 star
Neither person that ordered one had more than 2 bites. 

My friends did get the quiche and French onion soup and said both were good.  

I ended up eating cold chicken fingers and mushy noodles swimming in cheese.  No one in the restaurant seemed to notice that the vast majority of food that we ordered went uneaten. Needless to say we won't be back.
Such a great environment. Reminds me of a place in Austin. Quite homey feeling and just great vibes.

My very first time eating at the restaurant at food was awesome. I had the lobster roll and beignets, which were awesome. However the frittata, and the house made punch was also delightful. The restaurant has a French American cuisine that is truly great.

Great burgers today.  A great place to visit.  Service was amazing and Andre's burgers were yummy!.  Shawn was right there to offer suggestions on the menu.  The Manager Nikki gave a little history on the place dating back to the Rat Pack days.  We had fun and will definitely return with our friends soon..
We are visiting from California and are restaurant owners... we had the best dinner and service!!! Amazing happy hour too!!!!! Thank you Andre's for a fun and delicious dinner!!!!

The original Andre's was one of Las Vegas's iconic fine dining French restaurants.
It's was a pleasure to see that they were able to keep the feel of that dining experience and the wonderful food and apply it to this bistro.
The food was still wonderful, the atmosphere was nice and relaxed, and the location makes it easy.

I came here for Saturday brunch 4/8/17 and left full and happy. I ordered the fried chicken and waffle with the gravy and syrup on the side. I normally do not like gravy but their gravy was amazing! Great flavor 4/5. I wish the waffle was less cooked but it was still a very tasty meal. 
My husband ordered the lobster roll with the duck fat fries which were a 4/5. The flavor of the fries 5/5, however, the roll was a little smaller. We would definitely go back.

I don't get it. People who's opinion I respect rave about this place.

I'm going to try this again soon, but only because the food critics can't all be wrong! However, I won't take a large group here again until I've had a good experience - all but one person in the group I took was disappointed and frankly, surprised at the poor execution.

Absolutely everything was wrong when I took a group of 8 here. One of our group was a chef, so I was particularly embarrassed I'd planned this dinner out.

The food was decent, but the numerous mistakes on nearly every order combined with the server errors in judgment and tactics made for an unpleasant experience. Just a small sampling of numerous mistakes made: several people got the wrong dish - when one came out wrong a second time, the server stated the first dish was still in the back and he could go get it again! I ordered mussels, and had to ask for a bowl for shells, then use the spoon they brought me instead of a fork. We had to keep picking up our plates and handing them to the server so he'd take them away. A medium rare steak was medium well. 

And what is with the space on the side that looks like a soup kitchen? We all loved the dining and bar area, but couldn't figure out what the other room was about.
Went for dinner, the beet salad was so delicious we had to order two! It is a must try! Can't wait to try brunch.

What a wonderful neighborhood experience bringing the strip to the locals of southwest Las Vegas.  Truly happy with this cozy little gem in my neighborhood with a fun French fare.  The room is warm and comfortable, beautiful wine list, delicious food, and extremely knowledgeable waitstaff.  Ask for Mike W. as he is kind, attentive, and well educated in food and wine!  We had a romantic date pairing wines with our 3 course meal all delivered in a timely fashion allowing us to talk and relax.  The chilled seafood platter was divine, steaks tender, and the chocolate dessert decadent!  We will be back!

This hidden gem is my new favorite!  I have tried brunch, lunch and happy hour. 

Service is wonderful and  every item I've ordered has been, well.......Devine

From the fresh hot bread served to the table to decadent desserts, it is a winner!

Daily happy hour and lunch specials let everyone have a treat if a meal here, no matter the size of you wallet.  

Patio seating available too

Really great French place for date night. Review as follows ~~

Service: 5/5
Our server Nicholas was amazing. Super friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and gave amazing recommendations for sauces, wine pairings, and dessert! Water cups never reached half empty, and they were super accommodating when I didn't like the cocktail I ordered. I can't over state how amazing the service is here. 

Food: 4/5
Roasted Vegetable Terrain: 3.5/5
Personally, not my cup of tea. My boyfriend loved it, but I was pretty indifferent to it. I do like that they use quality ingredients, and the flavors complement the veggies rather than mask the taste. I didn't like the gelatinous texture, and I personally prefer richer foods. Recommend if you want something light and fresh. 

Gnocchi with pea purée: 4/5
I thought the gnocchi was a liiil' dense, but I really enjoyed the pea purée and the flavors. Really yummy vegetarian option ~

Ribeye steak with green peppercorn sauce: 4/5
The steak was overcooked. My boyfriend asked for medium rare, and it came out medium well. What really saved the meal for him was the green peppercorn sauce our server recommended. He said it was so good he could've eaten it as a soup. Separately, the steak was a 3/5 and the sauce was a 5/5. 

Mashed potatoes: 3.5/5
Mashed potatoes are always good, but they weren't anything special.

Chocolate and Vanilla Soufflé: 4/5
When our meal came out, our server gave us a heads up that the soufflé takes 20 minutes to make so we ordered before we ate. Five minutes after finishing, the soufflé came out. It was fantastically fluffy and rich, with a good rise. Plus, both flavors and sauces were amazing. 

Chocolate Pot de Créme with Vanilla Ice Cream: 4.5/5
Basically described to me as "chocolate pudding on steroids." Super rich dark chocolate pudding, topped with whipped cream and a sugar madeline cookie. Definitely recommend getting the vanilla ice cream to balance out the bitterness and the richness of the dark chocolate.  

Pricing: 4/5
I thought the prices were super reasonable. For one appetizer, two entrees, one side, two desserts, and two drinks, it came out to $120 before tip. The ingredients are quality, the taste is good, but I think the real steal here is the service.

Overall: 4/5
Overall, I totally recommend this place. Great place if you're craving French food, or you're looking for a cute place for date night ~

Andre's is delicious, they never disappoint me. 

I stop in on the weekends for breakfast, they make an amazing quiche Lorraine. I also enjoy the steak salad, which I have had a hard time finding a nice steak salad in Vegas other than Javier's.

Underwhelmed by the service and food. Very disappointed that while they provide crayons for children to color with there is no kids menu. We were charged $22.00 for a chicken breast for my 6 year old. Definitely will not be returning.

We arrived right on time for our 6:00 reservation and were quickly seated. Water and bread arrived while we looked over the menu. I think we got different bread than Sheila G did because it was just okay. And then we waited and waited with no one coming over. We finally flagged someone down and asked if anyone was working our table. He said "I can take your order". Ok then. 

We started off with some french wine and the french onion soup. For the entrees we ordered the trout almandine and the Ribeye steak. They ask you to order the souffle in advance which we did. A short time later another server came over and apologized telling us she had no idea she had our table. It is a pretty small restaurant with only a couple servers but I let it go as an honest mistake. 

Being at a french bistro with a french chef we had high hopes for the onion soup. Unfortunately it was a let down. Where's all the cheese?? It was baked on the outside of the bowl instead of inside with the onions and broth. There was some on the bread as well but I like a lot of cheese IN the soup. The entrees came out and the trout was presented very nicely with potatoes and green beans. I do agree with Sheila G that it just needed some more flavor. It was good, but not great. The green beans were cooked perfectly crisp. The ribeye was also good, cooked as ordered and tender. 

Finally the souffle came out and looked amazing. Surprisingly, even with the chocolate sauce I thought it wasn't sweet enough. The actual souffle was lacking chocolate flavor, but it was cooked perfectly. 

Andre's was a strong 3 stars for me, but I wouldn't be in any rush to return. Nothing stood out as amazing or outstanding. It was also very warm inside which I don't like when I am eating.

Poor and inattentive service!! Went for Sunday brunch and informed the waiter it was my first time there. First, he didn't even mention kids menu options when I ordered a full priced entree that I said was for my kids. He also seemed aloof and not mentally present in the sense he would walk around and totally walk right by me when I was trying to get his attention. The food was overpriced and mediocre. Ex. 22 bucks for some oveecooked mussels and fries. Shame.

Came here one night for dinner with a group of friends because of friends just bought a new home near by and the ratings on yelp were great. This place used to be DW bistro so when we went inside and looked around it still looked similar but the dinner settings were very dim. There were candles lit on our table and we used them to look at the menu. The service was okay not super amazing. Everything we wanted off the menu our server said was not available so I stuck with the chicken which was mediocre to say the least. I was pretty disappointed a lot of the foods that were posted on yelp that we wanted were unavailable and the server kept telling us that unfortunately since they opened not too long before we came they've revamped the menu a bit so some foods they will no longer serve. Our table ordered the moules frites which was a pretty hefty portion and okay. Also,
Escargot was something everyone tried at the table. That was good. I'd like to maybe give this place another try during happy hour or lunch to see if things may be different.
